Pretty good bass line, goes pretty loud, easy to connect, mute, switch off and on. All around a impressive headset so far especially considering the price of other products with similar quality

Easy to pair with my iphone 6s, easy to use, sweat proof, good crisp sound, excellent bass, not the least bit noise "cancelling" but they do lock out external sounds pretty well. There's only one catch. They're TOO LOUD for music. I keep my phone on notch 1 or 2 for media and it feels like I'm on notch 8. They work well enough for podcasts and I use them for that specific media but not for music. It's too bad, they're great for the price otherwise.
Love it! Great sound, easy set-up.
Comfortable, clear, easy
A

I really want to love these, but I’m having too many issues. I bought these a few months ago. The sound, for the most part, is very good. My first issue was that they kept falling out. I finally got that resolved by switching to a smaller earpiece in one ear. I’ve never had to mismatch earpieces with any other earbuds before, but whatever works I guess.

The bigger issue is that they keep cutting out on my constantly whenever I move around. I was out doing yard work and had my iPhone in my pocket. These things kept cutting out constantly. I couldn’t seem to keep a connection for longer than 30 seconds. This seems to be a rather new issue, as I’ve been able to run on a treadmill with these before (but with my phone in the cup holder) with no problem. I’ve tried putting the phone in my front pocket, using an arm band, and setting on a nearby ledge. Nothing seems to work.

A slightly lesser gripe (only because I wasn’t expecting it in the package) is that the included microUSB/Lightning convertible cable is crap. It has a “captured” microUSB to Lightening adapter on a flat cable. It looks great and sounds like a great idea. I have no idea whi these earbuds came with a Lightning cable when they only charge with microUSB, but great (I thought). The problem is that the cable keeps cutting out. I can’t trust it to charge my phone, so I won’t be using it any more.

I may have to see about making a warranty claim. Otherwise, they’re too frustrating to use.

My 5-Star rating is for the quality of service I received from Invotek and not for the quality of the headphones. I bought these headphones because I read a newspaper or magazine review that these headphones were comparable with $150 Apple headphones. I can't compare these with Apple, but these headphones are simply OK, not fantastic. I would rate these headphones as about 4 stars on it's own merits. It's fine for my use at the gym or out running, but if I wanted quality sound this would not be it.

The reason for my 5-Star rating is that these headphones died on me after just over a month....too late to return to Amazon. I then contacted Invotek's customer service on a Sunday, and by Wednesday, I had already received a brand new replacement set. These headphones come with a one year warranty. Backed by this kind of service, I really feel I got my money's worth and and happy with my purchase overall.

It’s only been two minutes since I’ve had them and they have way better sound than my Bose soundsports and AirPods. I can’t hear any outside noise which will be good for drowning out the gym’s poor choice of music.

$24 gets you more than you bargain for.

I was ruining my bluetooth Bose headphones at the gym.  The ear pads were getting funky from all the sweat.  I knew I had to find something to replace them and I wanted bluetooth earbuds; no more funky, sweaty ear pads.  I took a deep breath and ordered these.  I thought, "Well, they're not terribly expensive, so what have I got to lose?"  What a great find!  I'm used to the sound quality of the Bose and I gotta tell you, the sound on these little babies is pretty darn good!!  Okay, so what about distance?  Can I put my phone in the cubby and still receive a signal on the other side of the gym?  Yep, Sure can!  What about the battery?  Honestly, I only use them at the gym .. max. time 90 minutes.  When I get home, I pop them on the charger for about 30 minutes or so and I've never had a problem.  What about the cord?  This is where I was concerned.  I have waist length hair and was afraid the cord would get tangled up in my hair.  Nope, not a problem.  I'm pleasantly surprised and happy with my purchase.

I've had mine for a while now and they have proven to be well worth the price. In fact, for what I paid for these, I consider them to be a superb value. They're convenient to use, sound great, come with a very nice storage case, and so far have proven durable. For as many headphones as I've gone through, I'm happy that the Senso earphones I have are still going strong.
These are great not the greatest sound but work good.  Comfortable and good battery life.
They stopped charging 2 weeks after I bought them.

Imagine, if you will, a 1983 U-Haul. Turn the stereo on. Close your eyes. What do you hear?

These Senso headphones. They are shockingly terrible. Unless you have a vendetta against your own eardrums, don't buy these.

Didn't get a chance to try it because I am returning it.  The one star is for the disappointment on my son's face when he excitedly opened the box and found the seals of the headphone box was detached and the product looks used because earbuds look dirty.  He refused to even touch it.  I am expecting a brand new headphone in a brand new sealed box, not one that has been returned by another customer .
Had to return after a week. Stopped connecting to device.

Seems to work fine. Ear loops are flimsy but comfortable. Directions indicate  charging should not be left on over night an inconvenient restriction. Directions:"It is not recommended to charge headphones overnight"

I ordered this for my 16 year old son and he loves it, theres no more long cords hanging or constantly have to put up with ear piece to put it back in the ear. I'm looking forward to get one for myself. Thanks SENSO

Easy to use right out of the package. Bluetooth feature is very handy. The only negative is that the earpiece is not adjustable for smaller ears like mine. They still work fine, but don’t hold tightly. A good deal for the price.

Also, battery life seems to be about 3 hours, as opposed to 8.  Always seems run out of juice at the worst times - which is half me & half the battery :)
I purchased these to work.  This wire gets stuck in the neck area all the time.  Does not work good at all when some one calls you.  Batteries dies early.

The charger was broken after few weeks, sound started become lower and lower, now I am suffering and I can barely use it because of its sound quality, it's buds are easily taken of whenever you put it in your pocket or even if you keep it around your neck so I had to look for it three or four times a day. The customer service is horrible, when I complained about sound quality they sent me a message on how to reset the headphone, I tried resetting it and nothing changed, they stopped to response to me hoping after few days I will be passing one year of purchase date.
Senso bluetooth headphones.  This plays music well, however as a phone it lacks a decent microphone so people can hardly hear my voice.
Great buds!
Good product. I have been jogging with them and they've been great so far.

I love these headphones. I've had them for about a year now. For the price, they are phenomenal. I haven't tested the waterproof side of them past running with them when it's drizzling. I think that the 8-hr battery life is a stretch; I haven't had them last that long. However, I did notice that the distance from whatever your using as the device (i.e. phone) significantly affects the battery life. If I leave my phone in one place while at the gym and am moving around with varying distances, the battery drains much quicker. Whereas, if I have my phone in my back pocket the whole time, the battery lasts a lot longer. The longest I've gone in one sitting was 4 hrs. They charge up very quick. The sound is great when listening to music. I've never had any issues with them dropping calls or being able to pick up my voice. They came with several different charging cords so you can charge at home or in your vehicle. It also came with several different earbuds so you can fit them in whatever size ears you have. Overall, excellent product and definitely recommend this product.

This works fine for listening to audio, but phone calls are unbearable. Apparently everyone I try to speak to gets terrible "feedback" and weird audio anomalies. It sucks because I like these, but I have to return them and try another brand. I need to be able to make phone calls.
Bought them as a gift for my Dad to wear in his shop.  He loves them!  I am going to buy a pair for myself now also.
Wife has used these twice so far and loves them.
I do not like how these new version have adjustable ear loops, I wear them all day at work and when someone speaks and I pull it out the ear loop stretches out and I have to fix it constantly

Bought these for husband...he uses them daily and loves them!

I bought these for working out. It comes with a great zippered carry case as well all the adapters you will need for charging. The buttons are basic and simple. It paired quickly and well with my android phone. There is an audible cue to let you know the device is on. Sound quality has been excellent without any issues so far. I have yet to drain the battery. It advertises 8 hours of continuous use and the longest I have used it continuously is about 5 so far.
It comes with ear buds to resize for comfort.

So far the only downside I have found (which I believe is just a part of getting used to this earphone set) is having it get pulled out/off my hear while exercising. The loop around for your ear is soft and flexible.

Great product! It comes with everything you need and more. The earbuds sync very quickly to your phone and the sound fantastic. Couldn't ask for a better product for the price. I also purchased the 4 year warranty which was only $8.

Bass and the rest of the sound don't seem to go up proportionally when adjusted from the signal source...gets a bit boomy.

However, this can be a feature when turning up the phone independently of the earbuds to adjust the ratio.
The cord is way too long and gets caught on everything. The purpose of wireless headphones is to eliminate the cord so I'm not sure what they were thinking when they designed these.
Love it!!! I usually have a hard time finding a comfortable headset that stays in....This is it....
Awesome. Very surprised. Very clear detailed sound, comfy. Can walk all around the house with these. Highly highly recommend.

Using these for running, walking and general use. The over-the-ear loop helps hold them in place and the in-ear is comfortable. The volume gets very loud so I don't turn them all the way up often. Battery life is 8 hours +/- or about a week most of the time. I would buy these again.

High Fidelity for Low Cost
I didn't think that would really be possible, but these really are worth the money... I was coming off of losing my Shure's and those were only ordered after 10 years of loving my Etymotic in-ear monitors that finally broke... So spending the money on these wasn't the issue, but I read several reviews from users as well as industry reviews all of which said to give these a try. For the money, it was worth a try - and I'm glad I did.

I tried the original silicone buds at first, which were nice. BUT when I changed to the foam which is much like my Etymotics use to be, it was even better... great sound isolation (not noise cancelling) and solid performance. I can't imagine the other "big boys" being worth the extra money over the sound quality I'm experiencing out of these. I ordered 2 more sets for my girls...

I would recommend!
I bought these headphones for gym workouts. In gym environment sound quality is great.

Broke after a few months after purchase. Eventually just stopped pairing with devices and would cut out. Tried factory reset numerous times and it worked briefly and then would continue with the same problem.
On/off button jammed after 3 months use. Was working fine. Now useless. Very disappointing

Love them. For the price, I don't have to worry about what happens to them. I beat them up pretty good, and the keep turning on. Good sound for the price. Are the beats sound, no, but at the gym I don't need HD audio.
Got these Bluetooth earbuds for my wife. She loves them. She says that they are comfortable and the sound is great. She loves how she can watch fb videos and then answer her phone easily.

Sound quality is acceptable, plastic is cheap but works good. The headphones suddenly jump to full volume whenever I type for some reason. Battery lasts a long time. Overall, it’s definitely worth the price
they worked right out of the box!

They sound alright, no complaints.  My biggest issue is the functionality. The power button is in a location where every time you push the right piece into your ear, you turn the set off.  Then I grab the edges and push the volume buttons. So basically, my right ear piece keeps falling out.

Loved the pair I bought a few years ago, ordered another set and they are TERRIBLE now!!! Expecting the same quality, nothing like the last pair. Bad sound, cheap construction. Very disappointing. They even changed the little digital "voice" to an absolutely annoying, weird one. They're really quiet, can barely hear anything. No bass, just bad all around.
Great price comfortable to wear sound is very good  I use them with My Ipod when I walk my 10 to 12 miles each day  Only have had them for a few days but so far I'm very happy with them
I liked this headphones) good battery life, great sound, and very nice carry bag included with many ear cushions. Thanks, great job👏👏👏👏

I shower with these on, and they're perfectly fine still. Need I say more? Okay then, these are the best earphones you'll ever buy. Sounds like a scam? Too good to be true? Well ignore everything you've learned in life til now, just for this moment and select these earphones. Then proceed to the checkout.

I have had a few BT headsets for working outside and workouts. These are AWESOME!! Granted, I have only had them a few days. If anything bad happens, I will update this review. in the mean time:
Pros:
Wicked light, with or without the ear hooks
Good range for their design (20-30ft) at max. useful BT range. This is a good standard being and most of use have the transmitter (phone, ipod) with a few feet anyway. Think pocket, counter, machine tray, tool bench. Longer ranges require more power at both ends; thing CB Base stations for your phone and headset...ouch!
The Extras: case, dual micro usb/lighting to usb charge cable, extra tips, car charger and 10-in charge cable. The wire tie is golden; hold the wire slack out of the way and even semi-secures the wire behind your head or under the chin.
IPX7 Waterproof (not for swimming, but if you fall in these will be ok) great for sweat, rain and those who need/want them for showers.
Cons: None yet, will update if any arise.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. Love Mine!!

I have had a few pair of these but this is the first pair that have done this. No I didn't leave them out in the sun, I really have no clue why this happened. It was a progressive thing that started with the left one and then the right...they still work but...I look disease wearing them...
Work from home, on calls all day. This allows me to hear clearly. I can speak in a normal, conversation tone & they hear me clearly.
Great product. Good price!
These headphones work and sound great.  Can't get anything better for the price.
Didn’t hurt ears at all. Snug fit and sweat proof
This is my second pair of these headphones and the Bluetooth sound quality is terrible. The first pair that I've had for about a year before I broke the wire was great but this pair is just not good

As was mentioned before, the sound is great! I can hear slight nuances if songs while doing activities. The earbuds fit on you r ear even when sweating. Great quality for a great price. I would highly recommend to anyone not looking to spend a small fortune for workout earbuds.

Great device! 4 stars due to the wrap around ear piece really isn't that stiff, so the ear piece is liable to move under heavy activity. If you make that piece a bit stiffer or give it the ability to be 'tuned' to the wearers ear, definite 5 star+ range. Let me know if you need a tester!
very cheap,flimsy piece of plastic, but it does the job. the voice is ok.
Comfortable and great sound! Great product, especially for the price!
Great sound and long battery life.

My wife's review:  The sound is great - you can hear detail at very low volume without noise from the outside world.  It charges fast and seems to retain a charge nicely.  The ear pieces are taking some time to get used to.  I went from an Apple-style ear bud to this one and there's a definite adjustment curve ...for me anyway.

This is one set of headphones you want if you're on a budget. The sound is ok. Not great but not bad either. If you're used to full sized headphones these will be a bit disappointing. I paired it with my iPhone and pairing is simple enough.
There is, however, that subtle background hiss with these headphones that's hard to ignore once you know it's there. I don't see this a problem if you're out and about in the gym or in public. These are definitely not designed for critical listening. The bass is a bit boosted and the midrange is not as smooth as I want them to be.

When tested with a range of tracks, featuring a few popular hip-hop albums, some jazz, rock, and even the occasional metal track, the high-definition nature of the sound of the ActiveBuds S-250, including their deep bass and crisp treble, became apparent from the first few seconds.

Again the midrange is muddy sometimes.

However, this is certainly one set of headphones you should consider if you know its limitations.

The build quality is good. It comes with all the cables you need and it even comes with it own hard carrying case which is rare at this price point. It charges exactly how the manual says it would which is about 2 hours.

I've never been a fan of in-ear headphones but these are very comfortable. It comes with three silicone ear plugs.

The pricing, however, is a bit strange with the other two color combinations costing a few dollars more. But they're all still below $40.

I only gave it 4 stars because of the background hiss.

Recommendation: Why are you still reading this? Go get a pair 😊
Great product for the price. I was hesitant at first but I'm glad I went ahead with the purchase. Worth every penny. Sound is loud and clear and installation was super easy.
They lasted a month!  Won’t charge or turn on, waste of money!
Home use for listening to music from my cell phone.  Great product!

There's a buzzing noise in the background when you have the earphones on, but not listening to anything. Even when you start playing music, this buzzing noise never goes away. Really really annoying. I got these on a bit of a whim since I needed BT earphones. It’s hard to ignore 25,000 reviews, the majority of them positive. However I have been very disappointed in the fit and sound quality of these earphones.  Admittedly my ears are weird and I have trouble finding ear tips that are big enough. But I couldn’t get these to stay in at all using the largest tips I could find.  These earphones also sound very flat. No bass and very little trebble. I recently got a pair of earphones from Anker and they are much better on both counts.  I now regret purchasing these. Don’t make the same mistake!
good product

But these fit her perfectly, both comfortable and stay put.  It is great to see her wearing them around the house and singing as she goes.

Great product for the price. Wear them for biking and running. Sound was better than other running headphones I had tried at $100+. The battery died after 7 months, however their customer service was awesome and shipped a replacement pair promptly.

So far so good.  I recently purchased them and have used the Bluetooth ear buds only in the gym to date and have experienced no issues whatsoever.  They are comfortable and seem to stay in place with no problems.  The silicone ear pieces are nice and provide no irritation at all.  These are not noise deafening as advertised, however I really did not expect them to be (like a good pair of headphones would be)  The sound is very good and I especially enjoy the quick pairing with my I Phone where I keep my music.  I recently had a very bad experience with another pair of blue tooth ear buds that I purchased at a running expo at the Chicago Marathon in October of 2014. Prior to purchasing the Senso pair, these particular headphones went bad 4 times (would not charge)  Although the company sent me a new set 4 times, I have no faith that these will work over an extended period of time, so I am glad I looked at another product.  I hope to get back into running this spring after two knee operations in the past two years and it appears that this product will work out just fine.  Happy to date, thank you Senso!

My previous set up for running involved a wired Sennheiser sports headphone set that went behind my head with a cord that was just long enough to reach to my phone on my left bicep. With the new bluetooth headphones that have come out, I wanted to see if I could find a solution that would work with running.

These had great reviews and were cheap, so I gave them a try. When I first tried them on at my kitchen table, I thought they were a bit bulky and heavy. However, when I went out with them on my first run, they were very comfortable and I quickly stopped noticing them on my ears. The only thing that I really noticed was the cord lying on the back of my neck.

The controls are easy to use and reach, and the sound is good. Also hard to argue with the price!

Connection quality has been generally very good and when I asked people I'm talking on the phone with they never have trouble hearing me.

Unfortunately my first pair did break after 8 or so months of consistent use but I was impressed by their customer service response when I asked them about the warranty. They did have me try a quick factory reset just in case that could fix it up but after that failed to work they are sending out a replacement set.

I am very happy with this purchase and would recommend them to anyone.
Don't waste your time buying beats, these are way better and cheaper. The bass on them is amazing.
Sound is amazing and earbuds are comfortable. Very easy to set up.
bought this for my son, it sounds great, is stylish and functional,
Great headphones for the price
Excellent headphones, would highly recommend to anybody looking for wireless headphones to wear while working out.
"I use them every night to listen to music or watch TV, so I won't be disturbing my husbands sleep. Easy to use, easy to pair, and the sound is very clear!"
Excellent. Had to buy a second pair since my 20 yr old son took mine.

I am using these for outside running and other activities such as lawn work.  Syncs great with my S7 Edge and all controls work.  Sounds quality is definitely good enough for me.  They haven't come loose or fell off.
Audio quality is mediocre.  Battery charges fairly quickly, they are comfortable but audio quality is very disappointing.

Works great, sounds great !!!
Would recommend these to friends and family. Good product....
Awesome value for money! Have changed my workouts completely and so very well packed. Great accessories are included, esp the carry case to protect ur purchase
All I got to say it, buy it!!!
The ear buds r a little big
I like all the accessories with the earned headset. I dislike the part that around around ear....it is to large and can not bend to fit around my ear.

Good battery life, good Bluetooth connection. No bass, terrible voice.

Listening to music is not pleasant. The bass is almost completely absent. They work fine for listening to podcasts and news. Being wireless is more than just a convenience when I'm walking four dogs. The fit is comfortable and I can wear them for hours without even noticing they are there. I forgot to pick up my phone, and the bluetooth didn't cut out until I was at least 30 feet away. This is a great improvement over past headsets where I had to have my phone in the front pocket, not the back pocket, to avoid losing the signal. Trying to use them for a phone call is completely pointless. I sound like I just landed on the moon, but less clear.

This set will definitely be useful for some situations, but it does not work as advertised. I wanted to be able to use them to make phone calls, and that isn't happening.
Good for price. Great noise quality!
Nice sound, but they don't stay in place, constantly falling off of my ears. I was hoping and still wish that they were adjustable.

These are superior to my 90 JBL reflects in every way.  they are the first that I have found that fit correctly which is key to great sound.  They do start to sound staticy when the battery is getting low but once charged this goes away.  So far so good owned for a few weeks.  For the price they are hard to beat
works great!
Used once and lost it so I can’t really give a great review but sounded really good
Excellent quality sound, fits snug and securely, and very easy to use. The streamlined volume and multi-function buttons make it very easy to operate without having to take them off.
Great sound, cool design, good price, very satisfied!
Very comfortable, and the sound quality is awesome. Excellent for use in a hot tub.
No warranty support. Do not buy these. I have had 2 and they both died before the warranty was up and there was no support from senso. Try Mpow!!
Not a perfect fit for my ears.
So far so good! Enjoying the headphones and they are super comfortable. I hope they last. - March 19, 2018
Nice but not a total fan of the flemsy ear piece
Really good value for money!!!

I've had these for over a year and use them 4 days a week on the treadmill at the gym. The music at the gym is always so loud and these headphones absolutely cancel it out!! They are easy to wear, easy to charge (comes with its own charger) and the sound quality is phenomenal. They also come with several different sizes of silicone ear plugs and they stay in place over the ears. I highly recommend them and do to everyone I know.

I often watch instructional videos on my Mac and the volume is too low, especially if there's other noise nearby. I looked into boosting the Mac volume artificially using apps, but learned that that can damage the Mac speakers. This is the only pair of headphones I've tried that is able to significantly boost the volume (via noise cancellation or directional targeting or whatever) so that I can actually hear all of the videos. The handy hard carrying case is also nice so the headphones don't turn on accidentally due to physical pressure applied by surrounding objects. And there's three different sizes for the ear buds so that it tends to stay in my small ears for the most part. The design is visionary and so even if the buds fall out of my ear the hooks make it so there don't fall away and are easy to put back in.
I like the sound quality but the base is left wanting!!  That’s about all the battery life is great I can do audible books for hours a day I like it

Right price and works as promised.  The exercise routine is a bit easier when there is music in the background.  I am not an audio expert, but to me the sound is excellent.  I bought it so the ear buds would stay in my ears, however, the noise cancelling, sound reproduction, water resistant design and a reasonable price make this an outstanding product.  BTW, had a technical issue with the device and contacted SENSO tech support.  Received a response in about 20 minutes with easy to read and follow instructions on how to correct the issue.  After two minutes the issue was resolved and I'm back to the music.

Very happy with the headphones thus far. My main use of them is in the gym, I have worked out, run, and many different other activities at the gym and they have worked great throughout.....
As far as sound I am extremely happy, pairing the head phones to my phone was as easy as turning them on....
I would definitely recommend this wireless headphones.....I am very happy!

Overall, fantastic buy. Cannot go wrong with these headphones if you're on a budget and need some solid bluetooth wireless headphones.

Positives: Excellent sound quality, not absolutely mind blowing but very high definition sound and very reasonable bass as well. Reasonable battery life and very reasonable charging time. Volume goes extra loud, loud enough to damage hearing. Very sweat/dust resistant for the most part. Have been using these for 1 year, working out 4-6 times a week and they are in perfect shape.

Negatives: Sometimes bluetooth connection can be a little frustrating, if you connect to one device and then would like to connect to another device at a later point, you need to fiddle with it and turn it on and off a few times before it works. Low battery indicator is my only major complaint about these headphones -- specifically, it warns you of low battery when you only have roughly 5 or so minutes of listening time left. Low battery indicator should have been set to warn you when you have at least 20 minutes left so you can still use them for the remainder of a workout. Numerous times I found myself halfway into my workout with a battery low reminder and my headphones cut out at the end of the song.

Overall, solid 4/5 rating. For the $30 I dropped on these, they have exceeded my expectations far and beyond, and I would recommend them to anyone without a doubt.
One month old and they went completely dead.
I honestly believe the quality is ALMOST as good as the Dr things..
Charge doesn't seem to hold. I am not sure how this compares to other wireless.  Also would just get buds and not the clip thing.

I bought these after getting trying a model from a different brand that cost twice as much as these did.  These are more reliable, simpler controls/interface, and TWICE as loud as the other brand I purchased.  Plus, if these end up getting flooded with sweat or get messed up (which all sport headphones do eventually if you work out with them), they are way cheaper to replace.  Very happy with these headphones.

I have a pair of Bose earbuds and these put those things to shame!!! Deep bass, nice midrange and great highs....and loud as all get out!!! Controls are easy to work once you get used to them and they are comfortable as a fresh hotel pillow.

I got these on sale for $37--originally about $135!!! If they are still on sale get two pair.

Excellent sound, very comfy, good battery life, easy to setup and use. I've now had these since February and I'm even more pleased than when I first received them. I had previously purchased a pair of rechargeable ear buds from a shopping channel for over $30 and the SENSO
blows them away. I could not be more pleased with the sound and battery life.
Sound was ok, but it died after two weeks of light use and good care. Didn’t expect much at this price but was still disappointed.
Excellent, great sound quality, battery last a decent time, conversation is nice too.
Returned due to fit
Hang a bit too much off the ear
So far so great. Great sound quality, east to set up and sound didn't fade even when I started sweating during my run.
Sound quality is good, battery life is acceptable. However material is cheap, headphones are not durable, and are not suitable for wearing while running. Avoid.
Decent quality sound but the power button broke on me after two weeks of actual use.  Low rating is to reflect physical quality of product.

The caveat to this review is I just received them so this only an initial review. The buds have a good sound and functionality of the buds is simple.

They are comfortable and having different ear pieces this is a good thing. With ear canals differing I am able to choose my comfort.

The longevity of their performance is still a question hence only 4 stars. However at first blush they seem to be a good product
Have been using them for 2 weeks.  They connect fast to my Bluetooth and the battery last about 7 hours.  I'm very happy with the sound quality at this price level.

First time buyer of Senso products. I was very surprised by the quality of the product. The wireless headphones arrived with its own carry case, 1 short USB charge wire, 1 long ( I think 24") charge wire that can be used to charge the earbuds and iPhone, car charger converter with two USB output ports (1A, 2.1A), and different size replacement ear fittings.

I also received another surprise, communication via email from the company offering 24/7 phone support support and requesting feedback.

In the past two weeks I used the earbuds at work, metro, and while running/exercising. The average use time 6-8 hours per day.

The first thing worth to note, the Bluetooth range is awesome. In the past I had a few wireless earbuds and their range was terrible. With these earbuds, by accident, I discovered that at approximately 10-15m from my phone they still picked up my iPhone signal and played music perfectly.

The microphone quality is so so. Sometimes people on the other side of the phone conversation complained of my voice not being loud enough. I am not too concerned about that especially considering that I purchase them for listening to music while working or running.

I also do not have (so far) any issue with battery. I consider them to be a great buy at the current price level.
dont buy them , just waste of money

I have a pair of these headphones for myself that I absolutely love. I have even broke an old pair of these headphones (my fault completely) and didn't hesitate to buy another pair. So when my mom needed a new pair of headphones I automatically bought them for her! She already loves them and is using them on a daily basis.
I highly recommend them! Great quality headphones for a great price!
Stopped taking a charge after a few months of use.  Good while they worked, just stinks that I have to buy a few pairs every year

I work out six days a week and need headphones that can stand up to sweat and still sound good. Good build quality--these headphones seem built to last. Controls for phone access, volume levels and track advance and reverse are easy to use. Sound quality, is good; highs could be a little stronger, but perfectly acceptable. Only worn about trhree hours at most in one session, but didn't experience fatigue or discomfort.  Pleased with my purchase.
Best Bluetooth Headphone! Very sharp and clear. Very well made.
Cuts in/out whenever I move or walk. If I still had the packaging I would return.

Great! No more bugging the household with loud music etc.  Love these things. I get 4 and 5 hour IV's at the doctors periodically and I can jam on to my phones playlist without disturbing the nurses or other patients.
Good price and sound was fine but the earbuds wouldn't stay in my ears--I gave them to a friend and they worked for her.

I love the quality of the sound and how easy they are to handle. What I don't love is, even at a close range, certain angles get the signal interrupted. I tried using these for exercise and realized that the signal gets cut off whenever I dan my phone in my right pocket or side. If it weren't for this then I would have given 5 stars to this product.
I love them
bulky, and should be worn inside (the gym) because the wind will ruin your music
I gifted a close relative with these headphones and she is loving them.  A
Great sound, comfortable, long battery charge
I really like them! They work perfectly for the gym and that is whey I needed them. Gods souls quality and stay in place
Didn’t fit right, sound quality is decent, but don’t fit right and constantly have to adjust. Even after trying all the different size attachments.
These headphones are absolutely amazing and sound better than Power Beats in my opinion.
Really impressed. Super easy set up and charging. EXCELLENT sound. No slip during heavy workouts.
The best in the market at the unbelievable price. Exceptional customer service e.

These earbuds are great for the price. Good audio quality. However, the fit tends to hurt my ears after an hour of use. It is possible though, that a different set of ear tips could solve the problem. I would recommend these to someone looking for budget earbuds.

I am writing a review to express my frustration over the quality (or lack thereof), since it's way past my return window. These earphones have been spotty with volume in the left ear... and now, there is ZERO volume, ZERO sound in my left ear. I am tired of hoping something will change. These are destined for the trash, and now I must spend more $ money on a competitor's brand. I will not consider this brand again.

After I received them the other day,I charged them up, easily paired them with my iPhone and wore them for 2 1/2 hours walking and listening to music.  I was surprised and how good the sound is!  I was also easily able to work all the buttons on the earpiece to answer the phone & talk which was another positive surprise.  Best of all after I figured out how to put them on correctly they stayed in comfortably and did not fall out!  Also I love the case that came with them and the directions are very clear and easy to follow. So I am very happy with this product.

Battery life is great! Lasts almost all day at work! Sound is pretty good, although the stock AMG phones that came with my phone blow these out of the water, but those are corded. Noise cancellation is great, especially when I'm driving and don't want to hear the traffic noise. I have a set of bluetooth full wireless headphones that are good but dont have the battery power these do.

These headphones have exceeded my expectations. I have been running with these headphones in the hot humid summer we are expierencing. They are comfortable, stay securely on my ears, sound great and certainly appear to be very waterproof. ( Lots of sweat). I am very pleased with these headphones!

The left earbud broke off of the left base after about 30 days of use.

UPDATE: I called the warranty number and they said they would replace the unit. If it happens, I will update the rating. I started with a 1-star. We'll see. If it doesn't break, its great sound and lasts a long time.

They have communicated that they are sending a replacement set. Given how many they sell, it may be that some are bound to have faults that slip by.

When they worked, they worked very well, so as of now I am going to upgrade my rating, given they are sending a replacement with no questions asked..

I have had these headphones now for 10 months and they worked pretty good. The sounds quality on music is good with good bass, they are pretty comfortable to wear for extended periods. The problems I have had are:

1) Picks up a lot of outside noise while walking making it hard for people you are talking to to hear you.
2) Within the last week the sound is suddenly cutting out even though they are still connected to my device, I have to shut them off and back on to get them to work.
3) Sometimes the volume up and down buttons don't respond right away and then they work good.

I am still under warranty so I contacted Senso support and I'm working with them to fix the issue with sound cutting out. I will update once I have this figured out.

Like other reviews have said, even the lowest setting on my iPhone 7 is way too loud. I have tried resetting the headphones multiple times like Senso rep has instructed in their replies to other reviews with the same issue, however it doesn't seem to have any affect. It's a bummer because otherwise the headphones have been great, but I can't really use them as intended.

Had these for a month and literally had any use with them. Wore them once or twice for a jog and left them alone. Used them the other day at work and they fell apart. Save your money and don't waste it on this crap.
Love these headphones!
Love these. I did have to buy a second pair after the first died after a year. I didn't give it a second thought. This new pair has an adjustable ear clip, which is great.

These earbuds have pretty good sound quality. I'm not going to complain about that. What I do take issue with is the design of the controls. There are volume +/- buttons and one multi-function button. The multi-function button only responds to how long you press it for. A quick press is play/pause, a two second press is skip, and longer than that turns it off. The only other function on it is re-dial. I don't know why, but I guess that's an important one. The multi-function button is positioned directly over your ear canal so any attempt to mess with it drives the device deeper into your ear, which, for me at least, ranges from unpleasant to painful. I've also never had the skip song function actually work. It beeps like it did something but then nothing happens.

While this is a good headset for listening to music, it's a very poor remote-control. Considering the impressive range of control offered by a single button on other earbud options, I'm very disappointed with what's offered here.
Great product, great sound. I took away one star because one earphone stopped working within 5 months.
Terrible quality. Used for 2 workouts and never worked again.
Operates as advertised.  The earpieces hang well and provide a secure and good sounding connection as we walk.

it was great for about a month with every other day usage.  then the sound started skipping when turned on but was still working.  then about 2 months after purchase, as i just connected it to the charger using the provided cable, an immediate burnt smell of metal was noticed.  i quickly unplugged the unit from charging. indeed the burnt smell was coming from the headset and the microSD connector was melted.  so it's dead. has anybody experienced this? update: they sent me a replacement very quickly.  this unit worked OK until it was dead again after about 8 months: cannot be turned on and LED does not turn on while charging.  Senso sent me instruction on how to re-set to default setting and i tried that x2 but it was still dead.  This time around senso can only offer a 5% discount for the next purchase.  Why would i want to buy this again?  if you are attracted to the price then do consider buying the protection plan.

I bought these for my fiancé and she likes them a lot. They get really loud. The battery lasted about 15 hours over the course of about 3-4 weeks of working out coming out of the package. (She just had to charge them) They seem great for the price.
It seems that the signal will be interrupted when your phone is in the pocket and your head turns around. And it will get uncomfortable to wear the earbud for a while.

Was excited to receive these as they had great reviews and the price point was perfect.  Worked great for the price...for a little over a month.  Used probably 15 times and they are completely dead already.  Just outside the return window of course.  Buyer beware, you get what you pay for

Product arrived on time and as described. I generally don't have good luck with earbuds fitting and staying in my ears but the medium size that came with these fit well and I haven't had any trouble so far with these staying in my ears. I like to run everyday (2-3 miles) and have been using these for about a week. So far they have always stayed in my ears, stayed connected to my phone, and have perfectly fine sound quality for what I would expect for this price range. The carrying case these come with are really nice for traveling with these and I liked that these came with all the accessories to charge these under nearly any circumstance. So far using these for running or walking to/from school I haven't had them die/lose charge so I think the 8 hour time they are advertised with is pretty accurate. Overall I would recommend these.
They were intuitive to initially use and operate perfectly!  Great value!

I've had these for a couple of weeks. The company is very responsive. They sent me an email immediately after I received them wanting to know how I liked them and to reach out for any follow-ups (for $30 headphones I was impressed). I've paired them with my Apple Watch and iPhone 7 and it seems to work well. No complaints so far. Will take a little to get use to the wrap around earphones if you haven't wore them before, but overall they are snug and stay put. I've ran with them and mowed the yard and they stayed in fine. When I'm at work (since they fit snug in your ear) it blocks out noise so I can't hear my coworkers, so I miss requests I would normally hear with the Apple headphones. No complaining though, some times they need to be tuned out! Overall, I would recommend to a friend and my wife is thinking of getting some.
Great price for the sound!

Sound quality is spotty. Even with the paired device right next to the headphones, the sound cuts in and out- similar to what happens when the paired device is almost out of range for the headphones. Other than that the fit and usability is ok for the price point.
Excellent headphones, sound is pretty good.  Accessories are really nice as well.

These worked well while they lasted, but after only using them maybe 5 times, the ear bud separated from the base of the headphones and now they are completely useless. Super irritated they didn't last. Looks like the return window was only a month (it's been 3 months since I bought them).

I highly recommend these headphones the sound quality is superb the only drawback that I have is there can be outside noise rather sometimes they are a little noisy other than that I recommend fast delivery thank you
How can I return this staff for one year warranty not working anymore won’t let me connect it?

I just received by Senso Bluetooth headphones and didn't know what to expect based upon their relative low price, but I was pleasantly surprised because I have small ear canals and the small gel ear tips and the sound tube allowed me to get the perfect fit for my ears.  Pairing was easy with my iPhone 6 and the sound is very impressive.  I am not an audiophile but in my personal opinion it has good bass, treble and midrange.  You get a neat dual long power cord for micro-USB and lighting connector Apple devices along with a short USB power cord and 2 outlet cigarette charger all for the low price around $35 bucks with a one year warranty.  I bought these because I was going on vacation near swimming pools and the beach and these have an IPX 7 rating and will be perfect for my poolside lounging.  For the price, accessories and sound you can't go wrong with these.

I loved these things but they stopped charging after a few months of use (started using in April and quit in July). So disappointed as they were exactly what I wanted. They were comfortable, have great range, and had great battery life until this issue made them totally useless.

UPDATE:
After sending me an email with instructions to trouble shoot the issue with no luck, they immediately sent me a replacement set under the 1 year warranty. While bummed that it happened in the first place, I am very pleased with their customer service.
The best Bluetooth headset you can ever have!
really good ear buds.. not so great with noise cancellation, which is why I brought them for... background noise at work
Great sound, bass, and the charging light isn't too bright

Seriously, I love these headphones. Sound quality is superb. Price was great. Mine were missing the wire wrap - no big deal. Seller said they would hip a replacement. I've yet to receive it but they did issue me a $5 refund. I'd buy these again in a heartbeat.
Nice sound. Easy to use.  Pairing was a little slow but eventually worked.

I have small ears. The Apple earbuds are so big they don't fit into my ears. I thought these would be great - as they wrap around and I could were them while working out. The part that fits around your ear is so big - they wouldn't't stay on.
Returned it. Didn't like the feel. Kept falling out during workout. And sound quality wasn't that great either.

I've only had them for 3 days but I have used them 3 times and I am very happy with the sound quality while I'm running. The big test will be on my motorcycle. I've been told they have good sound quality for phone calls also, so overall I'd have to say I'm very pleased so far.

So, after using them for 6 months the right speaker stopped working. As they are under warranty I contacted Invotek. Within 36 hours they had talked me through an attempt to do a factory reset and, when that failed, had a replacement in the mail. Excellent value, excellent sound, excellent customer service!!

Definitely would recommend these headphones for those on a budget. These headphones have great quality as well as they are comfortable and super versatile. However, you cannot go too far with the Bluetooth as the connection gets very weak.

If you are concerned about sound quality, do not waste your money on these. However, they are fairly comfortable to wear. And, they come with a 2 port cigarette lighter charger as well as a micro USB/lightning cable.
These sound great! The problem I have with them is they don't stay on my ears when I tilt my head.  Also, the cord snag on my neckline and pull the buds out as well when maneuvering under vehicles.

I love the concept, how long the battery stays charged and the convenience.  I would have given these 5 stars but the hoops that go around the ears are too big for my ears and I cannot adjust them to a smaller size.

I've purchased two pairs. The first was June 2017 (Red) and the second pair (Blue) in September 2017. I bought the second pair so that I could keep one charged while using the second pair.

They get 4.5 stars.

I didn't purchase these because I'm an athlete so can't say how well they work in regards to exercise. However, I used to run and bike and in my opinion, I do believe, if I was still doing those particular activities, these would be better than any other earbuds I've owned.

Due to illness I'm pretty much sedentary at the moment so I use these to watch TV and I listen to alot of audiobooks through my phone or computer. The length of the books I listen to range from 5 hours (short story) to 65 hours (for a series). Listening to them at night helps me fall asleep. Plus, living in an apartment with thin walls, my wearing headphones while watching action/sci-fi movies keeps the neighbors from banging on the walls when they aren't as interested in hearing the space battles, gun fights, and car chases as much as I am.

Every other earbud or headphone I've purchased has caused outer ear pain after wearing them for a couple of hours. I tried to make sure I took the earbuds or headphones off before falling asleep. Most times I fell asleep with them on and then woke up in an hour or two with outer ear pain. Being a side sleeper only made it worse.

The first time I fell asleep with these earbuds in, I woke up 5 hours later and had zero discomfort. I've listened to some lengthy books (the page turners you don't want to put down) until the battery ran down and then switched to the other set of earbuds to continue listening without any discomfort. I've taken a break, shut off an audiobook or TV, and forgotten I even had the earbuds in.

Noise cancelling isn't great. My new neighbor upstairs likes to crank up her stereo occassionally on weekends. These earbuds don't cancel noise but they do reduce the noise by about 30%.

(Side Note: for my dumbest noise test, I recently purchased a VitaMix blender and wanted to know hese earbuds would help reduce/block any of the sound. A Vitamix blender can generate a lot of noise. In my test, I turned the Vitamix on to level 10 (highest) and I could only tell a very small difference with the earbuds in versus when they were not. Of course, I could turn on the Vitamix to level 10, walk 150 feet outside of my apartment and still hear it (without the earbuds). I know these earbuds aren't made to block that level of sound but was curious and as I mentioned, it was a dumb test.)

Now for minor (to me at least) complaints. As I mentioned, I purchased 2 sets, 3 months apart. Another reason I bought the second set was to try to avoid wearing out the first set from extended use. I constantly switch in between the earbuds.

The first set (Red) is still working fine with the exception of the battery life. In less than 12 months it is down to only holding 5 to 6 hours of charge.

The second set (Blue) battery life is about 7 hours. However, the right speaker's volume is only about half the volume of the left speaker. I clean the earbuds with alcohol wipes daily for hygenic reasons so there is nothing clogging either the earbuds (or my right ear). It just suddenly decreased in volume about 2 weeks ago. I checked it with multiple audio sources (audiobooks, music, phone calls) and it's the same for all of them.

I have an Android phone from Google that I use for night and sometimes day listening to audiobooks. The bluetooth range before I start breaking up is pretty decent and I only have a problem in one 2 square foot section in my bathroom. Moving 1 foot in any direction clears it. The signal only has to travel through, at most, one wall in any other part of the apartment which doesn't present a problem. Outside I don't have any problem listening or talking 30 feet from my phone.

I had to buy a special bluetooth adapter for my Windows 7 computer in order to get a signal since Windows 7 didn't have the latest and greatest bluetooth version. My Windows 10 laptop didn't have the same problem. I have had some issues with synching requiring me to power of the earbuds or the device I'm trying to synch to, and sometimes both, before I make a connection. 98% of the time it's not an issue.

One positive feature of these earbuds can also be a minor annoyance at times. The earbuds can communicate with two devices so if you let your earbuds connect to your phone, so you can receive calls, you can also connect to another device (i.e. TV) and watch a movie. The problem is that it seems to be a "first come first synched" situation.

I have my Android Phone, Windows 10 laptop, Windows 7 desktop. If they are all producing a Bluetooth signal, and I power on the earbuds to use with my phone, the computers seem to be able to synch with the earbuds fastest, but not always. Sometimes I'm trying to connect to my laptop or desktop and either of those devices will tell me they can't connect. Since the earbuds only tell you that they've connected, but not to what, I have to shut down the bluetooth on all 3 devices and then turn only the one or two on so I get synched to the devices I want. Minor annoyance only since I've "mostly" gotten used to it.

I've worn these (carefully) in the shower a few times to see how well they worked and they seem to be pretty water "resistant". Sound quality for what I use them for is very good. I listen to music occassionally and, while I'm not an audiophile, I'm happy with the sound quality including bass. I've even heard some instruments on some orchestral arrangements that I'd missed on regular speakers.

For me, comfort and wear time is 80% of what I look for in earbuds/headphones. These get 4.5 stars for that.

The other 20% is a mix of battery life, sound quality, device quality, ease of use, price, etc. I've deducted 1/2 star because of the progressive decrease in battery life. I expect there to be a gradual decrease but I didn't expect there to be an almost 40% decrease in 11 months. Also, the right earbud volume failing is annoying but, for audiobooks it's not critical. I haven't looked to see if anyone else has mentioned an issue with the battery life. As long as it doesn't decrease any faster then I should still have a usuable product for the next year. After that, it will just feel like I'm using an earlier generation that only had a couple of hours of play time.

But, if I need replace a set, unless something else came on the market that was considerably better and less expensive, I would buy these again.

The sound on these are great but that's about it. They hurt my ears and when I was walking and had the phone on my left arm it would cut out all the time, but when it was on the other side it was fine. Didn't like these for those two reasons.
These sound great, but sweat burned up first pair, so I tried again.  Same thing happened on the second pair.  Be warned.
Great sound, easy to use.

Used everyday at work,battery lasted almost 16 hours. Has fare sound. The main problem is it will start disconnecting from the phone even when it is just in my pocket.  That happens for about a week then it won't charge ( no light and no charge) basically just dead. Bought the first one  it lasted  11 months, second one  9 months.

I could not pair the buds with my phone.
Now what do I do next?
Pretty decent sound - I have the bose noise cxl'ing ear bud that deliver better quality sound - but with all the cords and power packs so these are much more convenient.

I've never had wireless headphones before - so I don't have much to compare these against but I LOVE these. They work extremely well, hold a long charge, sound great, and I've had no issues syncing to bluetooth devices! I would definitely recommend these to someone looking for wireless headphones to work out with/etc.

Better than Beats!! I absolutely LOVE my earbuds. I can go from my room to the other end of my house with these. Sound is great! My ears are tiny so the extra ear buds was a plus. I wish The ear holder thingy could be flexible in sizing so I could decrease the size (as stated earlier my ears are tiny) but that’s a personal issue/preference.
i love it !! HD SOUND!! you cant even feel them on you.. battery really good .. music is loud .. you cant even the outside world... if i ever lose this .. i will buy them again
They.work great for music, but very bad when phone call comes in. You either have an echo or cannot hear you because surrounding noise drowns you out. Hard to be heard when driving or outside.

These are a great price and great quality set of headphones.  They are a great value.  The blue-tooth pairing was effortless and the sound is awesome.  They stayed put in my ears throughout my entire workout through the sweat and all.
Love them👍🏻

Love the quality of the earphones!! Used it running the other day and they are great!! Great sound and quality! The only thing is I would improve the style, I wish is was 2 seperate ear pieces instead of the attatched cord piece.
Got them synced up to my phone. Enjoy the quality of sound. Easy to sync up

I had a pair of these for years and I am returning to buy them again after my dog chewed up my previous pair. Great sound quality, comfortable and pliable material to fit your ear, acceptable battery life and bluetooth range. Definitely recommend.
Does the job it's designed for. Wish it wasn't as bass heavy as it is, but it's not terrible. Definitely beats having to use corded headphones when jogging!

Finally, earphones that are comfortable and don't falll out of my ears. The wireless Bluetooth connection is an added bonus.

Sound is good, especially for this price point. Simple to set up and operate, although I find the volume control a bit tricky. The button are small. Don't know what they could do given the real estate they have to work with. Also, you can just adjust the volume on your phone.

I like the one-touch on/off button on the side. Easy to find. I also like the fact a voice tells you "power on" or "power off" so there's no confusion if you mis-punch.

Overall, well-designed at a reasonable price. Only question left is whether they're durable. Based on many other reviews I've read, I'm not worried.

Would definitely recommend to a friend.
Good product love them
These buds do what they say they will do. They are clear and stay in place while I ride my bike. I would recommend them to anyone who wants wireless buds that are sweatproof!
Great sound quality, very good instructions, comfortable to wear and love the carrying case!
Simple, functional and has better range than most. Great product.
So the earpiece broke really fast and I was bummed. They worked okay while they were functional. But they were on the cheaper side, so you get what you pay for.
So far so good. Comfortable and decent sound quality. Not the best but for the cost it is as good as I suspected. I hope they last longer than previous brands I have bought.
Good quality and sound, I recommend them!

I have only had these headphones for a few days, but thus far I am really impressed.  Bluetooth set up was quick and easy on my iPhone 6.  Sound quality is very good.  Used them for a workout in the gym and they stayed in place and sound quality was excellent throughout my workout.  Packaging is first rate and includes a complete assortment of accessories.  I have not had a need to contact customer service, they the fact that they have reached out to me proactively is an impressive indication of they desire to assist their customers.  Nice touch!

Lightweight but missing many features. It is not noise cancelling. I don't know what Senso defines as noise cancelling but this is not it. The form factor is kind of ridiculous overall. The actual headphones are really small but I suppose it's because I'm a bigger person. On the plus side they stay in your ears but overall this purchase is a disappointment and now Amazon won't let me return it for free.
Excellent!!!
the headphones are very comfortable and the sound is clear all and all a very good product

Good audio quality.  Controls are easy to use - they are highly intuitive so I learned them quickly. Manual is clearly written & concise.  Audio quality is clear. Fit comfortably with eyeglasses.  Email support question was responded to promptly on a Saturday morning & reminded me of exactly what I needed to do to run smoothly.
Husband loves them! Just what he was looking for to use with his iPad.
They didn't fit well in my ears initially, but after realizing I can shape them to my ears they haven't been falling out ever since.
they lose Bluetooth Constantly, even if my phone is in my pocket.
Muy buen producto para hacer ejercicio

I use these for listening to music when I’m working out. So far the battery life and sound quality has been good. I like that the ear piece is moldable and that I can bend it around my ear. The earbuds stay in my ears pretty well when I’m lifting, but I have a little bit of trouble when I’m running. I may need to play around with the ear tips a bit more.

I bought these to replace my Powerbeats3 headphones that proved to be less than sweatproof. The Senso headphones have performed very well and they really hold up during long runs without cutting out. I'd say the sound quality isn't quite as good as the Powerbeats3 but that's not a big issue for me anyways.

In 2 months of use: I use the cell phone in my armband, and I hear a minimal loss of signal, almost imperceptible. As for the support, it's good, it does not bother me while Im running. The battery lasts more than 3 days of use, 1 hour per day.
Love them!! Great buy!!
I used my son's Beats wireless headphones and I think these are just as good.  Excellent sound - very good value for the money.
The Bluetooth headphones are great.  I have no problems

I really wish I could give negative stars. Not even a week after receiving this product the power cord stopped working. It's an off size for charging so I could not find a compatible cord. I contacted the company and was told they would send me a new charging cord right away. Never heard from them again. Now I have a pair of useless headphones. What a waste of money.
Buenísimos
These headphones are a good fit and exceptional sound quality. I did not have any problem linking to my android. What else can i say, Ilike them a lot.

I've used my Sensos a few times and so far no issues. They are very convenient, the cord doesn't get in the way while I'm at the gym, it fit and stays on/in my ears, and the volume is great.  I love the carrying case, the  dual charger,  and the charging cord that comes with it. I'm able to charge my earbuds as well as my phone so my old cord has been replaced with my new multi functioning cord. Thanks Senso 👈🏾👍🏾👌🏾😊

I've used this item about 5-6 times and now it doesn't connect to any device. No wonder it was 30 dollars.

I would not recommend.
Very quality item, so good sound, the bass is awesome, battery is good.
Love this product - I am giving it a 5 star rating - great sound.
easy to used and very  comfortable.

It is a good product for having only used it for a week. I like that there is a voice that tells you if it has paired with your device or not. Also, there are multiple silicone earpiece covers that you can use to try and find the best fit for your ears. However, unfortunately after trying all of the different sizes I was unable to use a size that was suitable for my workouts. I will say though that my workouts are intense in the sense that I do a lot of jumping, running and head movement. Thus, these keep falling out and I can't have headphones that require I tend to them often.

Overall, if you work out hard to intense I would suggest finding some headphones that will sit in/on your ear a little bit better.

I'll give them 2 stars because they did sound good when they worked. I have only had them for a few months and they just stopped working. I use them when paddling on the lake just in case they get wet. Today I went to charge them and the light won't come on and they will no longer turn on. Worked fine last week and now........nothing. Same thing happened to my wife who had ones that looked exactly the same (different clone brand).
When they did work, they are not comfortable to wear with sunglasses due to the wrap around feature. Also, they never really stayed securely in my ears.
Great for hands free phone calls and listening to music when jogging. Clear sound.
Very good quality, has a lot of sweet add ons and even better price
Works as expected.  Great sound, deep base.  Can't beat it for the price.

Let me start with the "Cons" because I'm offended by advertising for this product (I still gave it 4 stars)

Cons:
- No they are NOT Noise Cancelling. False advertisement on the part of the manufacturer. The box it came in shows "CVC 6.0 Noise Cancellation" on the front, but there is no noise cancellation at all (this is called lying!). If you do a search on "cvc 6.0 noise cancellation" you will see reference to both the CVC/Qualcomm technology and another link about CVC 6.0 noise cancellation being Active Noise Cancellation.
- Their passive noise cancellation is non existent. Just a marketing ploy. I have a pair of "Passive Noise Cancellation" headphone which do a good job of blocking noise, but these do ZERO for blocking noise

Pros:
- Light & comfortable on my ears.
- Good Microphone. Called my brother and a friend to get their opinion on the mic sound, both felt it was as clear as the iPhone mic (I switched back and forth)
- The buttons are well placed and work easily.
- Sound is good, not great.
- All of the accessories are good. Glad to have everything I need with this product (have not tried the car charger yet)
- Price is reasonable for what you get (build seems good so far - just 2 days of using it).
- The support service was good. I spoke to Senso (very polite gentlemen) about the noise cancellation and about my gripe that they were doing some false advertising. He can't do much about it of course, but I was impressed that someone answered on a Saturday morning. This might be enough reason for me giving them a 4 star.
Thank you.  I bought one for me and on for my son.  I like the bass these put out.

I just received the headphones a couple of days ago, but so far I have been impr seed with the quality and ease of use. Nice packaging which included everything I needed. Paired real easy with my iPhone7. I would recommend.
They are a great little set of headphones. awesome sound

I really like these. I just bought a brand new pair after i accidentally broke my first pair. I did like the ear piece of the original pair though. The part that wraps around your ear on the new ones is moldable with wire inside which makes it harder for me to just quick slide them on. I prefer  the older ear piece.

The headphones sounded fine when being used to partially squash the kill-me-now boredom of treadmills. They worked fine outside too. But this is my second pair that has failed. Senso was helpful and sent a replacement when the first one stopped working in a few months. The second pair works, but will not hold a charge. Unless I remember to charge them *immediately* before use, they are dead, and if charged they don't hold up for too long. Outside, I can live with this.  But....imagine my plight as I approach the indoor hamster wheel on a cold or rainy day ...only to find my headphones not willing to do their part in saving my sanity? Yes, I know #firstworldproblems and all that.  It has been just over a year since my original pair (and 8 months since my second).
Comfortable to wear, easy to pair, and sound good for the price.
I really enjoyed these headphones for the price. They died after a year of use though, so that’s a bummer!

I had a GREAT headset off of Amazon over a year ago but they stopped charging. I will say I'm a  mega sweater and my last ones lasted longer than any Sony headphones, but they no longer were made and this was the closest option. The battery doesn't last too long, if I put my phone in my pant pockets it will disconnect as if its too far. Once its at 15% or 10% it gives a warning like every 30 seconds which is annoying. They do the job for short term workouts and work days
Very good headphones overall. Whatever you do, try to avoid "maxing out the volume" as much as you can. Audiophiles such as myself really can't help myself
I received my earbuds in a timely fashion they were easy to pair with my phone and sound really good for the price. I only wish the lows sounded a little better.

loud battery life about 8 hours only issue was the cap popped off of one ear piece about 6 months in but SENSO replaced the whole thing! Same day one call! this is a great company
use the natural foam ear buds watch for ear damage due to the loudness and check the caps where the red logo is every so often and maybe hit it with dab of super glue to hold it on
other than that these rock
well update for third time the covers popped off and for the third time they stopped charging so derated my review to three stars
It's okay

These headphones work really well and are comfortable. I used them for running and working out, but also they came in handy because they seem to boost audio volume considerably. This was good for videos and lectures I watched that were hard to hear.
After working perfectly for about 11 months, when the battery died one day, the headphones wouldn't recharge or come back on. However, I contacted customer service and they were true to their "Hassle Free 1 year warranty," and sent me a replacement right away!

not the best quiality sound ... you do get what you pay for. the bass that comes from the headset sounds pretty bad like if the speaker was popped the ear pieces that go around your ear to hold the earpiece in place move and are very flexible when i try to place the right earpiece in i always pause the music or turn the volume up or. down due to the fact that the control is located there wouldn’t recommend them if you’re an active person and enjoy quality sounds
I dont like it at all.The sound is awful and the bass is really bad.My iphone headphones are way more better than this.

Overall good value. Stay connected, , clear calls, good sound  and are reasonably priced. My only minor issue in the first week was when they let you know the battery was low, you have about 1min. I would have like them to have finished my workout. Not a big deal  moving forward, I'll just charge them sooner.
Shipped on time, sound quality is good. Little disappointed with battery life. One minute indicator shows half and then it drops to zero within minute.

There is only a warning 10 minutes before power is out. Excessive time to connect to broadcast device, as well as the first 15 seconds being flakey. Ear loops don't provide much/any ability to stay on the ear. Audio is below par
Bought this for the reliability and water resistance. First time getting wet (not submerged) and 1 headphone went out and now only plays intermittently.
Great sound and quality. My only complaint is that the “over the ear” silcolone component is looser than I expected.

I haven't used them much, I got them to walk and use at the gym,
So far, they sound great, fit well, are very light and stay out of the way, all the reasons I bought them.
I may have given a 5 star rating if I had more time to use them.
It stop working after a month of me using it
Love these earbuds! My favorite ones to wear out of five different models that I own.

The experience with the seller was fine, box arrived in perfect shape and all as described. My only concern at this point is that the headphones start to "skip" (I don't know how else to describe it) after 30 or 40 mins of use even after a full charge. I replied to a message I received Tekatron with this information shortly after the purchase but have not yet heard anything back. Other than that, these have great (probably the best) sound I have heard from a wireless head set.
great value for its price

I am able to fit them in my ears and not worry about them falling out. The only minor issue I have noticed, is me pausing my music when I re-install them.  I let my sister wear them for a little while and she has asked that I order her a pair, if that tells you anything.

After my $150 JBL headphones stopped charging, I took a gamble based on reviews and bought these.  I was a little skeptical, but from the minute out of the box to my first workout they over delivered.  I'm not really an audiophile so I can't speak to the sound quality, but for someone that just wants an easy way to listen to music while running or a hands free microphone, these are great.

The customer support at Senso is truly amazing.  I received a defective pair of ear buds and new replacements arrived within two days.  The process was simple and direct.  The folks at Senso are to be commended for their commitment to their customers.  I would rate them at the absolute top.
Purchased these for my 11-year-old son so he could listen to books as he reads along.  He says they are comfortable and set up was a breeze!
Awesome headphones!  Very satisfied!
The headphones sound great and were super easy to pair with my phone.  Have used them primarily to work out in the yard, but plan on using them to work out as well.  Very comfortable.

I had a pair of beats that were very close to these but accidentally broke them with my break bar in my car when charging. I didn’t want to spend a ton of money to replace something that might have the same thing happen to them so I got these. The battery life is 10x better than my beats were and I can tell no difference in music quality. And it came with an awesome magnet to mount my phone in the car.
Good sound quality, no connection issues. Overall solid product
Great product at a great price.

I ordered these headphones in August, and they worked fine for 3 months.  But all of the sudden they stopped working mid-workout.  I tried recharging the headphones, but they just appear to be dead.  Tried contacting the company from their website, but they didn't have an means of reaching to them.  Sad.
Worked well the first 8-10 times using, now it won’t charge. Contacting to see if I can get a replacement.

AWFUL sound quality. It sounds like there is a huge barrier of sound sucking material between the driver and your ears. I had to spike the high frequencies in spotify's EQ to get a decent sound and when paired and playing in my car, I would have to turn the EQ back off again. FYI, these are the same headphones as the TrendHolders bluetooth earbuds. Both identically bad sound quality.

I'll save you the headaches and just tell you to get the Symphonized NRG earbuds. They sound great, are cheap and have the over ear piece to help hold them in place.
Worth the money you pay!!
Bought these as a present for my teenage son. He likes them quite a bit. Says they are comfortable and stay on while he's shooting hoops.
I love them!!! I had no idea for the price I paid they would sound so amazing!!! I now know why they are the number one seller!! Buy them!!!!!!
Excellent product ! Easy to pair with good quality sound. Case and charging accessories make use and storage easy.
So far these are the most comfortable buds for my small ear holes!  Rating how well they stay in my ears, I give them an 8.5 out of 10.  Quality is great and they are comfortable.
These are great headphones; very comfortable, good sound quality, fun to wear.  Thanks for a wonderful product!
Excellent product. Easy setup. Very lightweight. Nice bonus items (chargers & cords) included in package.
Excellent product at a great price. Comfortable with great sound quality.

Greatest headphones ever. Tremendous sound quality. Very comfortable and easy to operate. I use them to listen to Pandora music. I am in bed now using them. I don,t want to
remove them. Thank you for such wonderful product., Extremely satisfied. Ron

Owned these for a month now.  Great for running and working out - as these do not fall out of your ear like the standard ear buds do.  Battery lasts for several hours; I am very happy with the product and the price point is a plus for what you get.  I would highly recommend the product.  Regards

Fast to connect to my bluetooth Pixel. Works very well for calls.

I like the quality of the sound at a very affordable price. Easy to use and that it is waterproof is a big plus!

Great sound, lasts for hours, sweat resistant
comfy, pair easily with Samsung Note 4, but from the rumors wonder how they will do wit Oreo
