I recently purchased a V-moda Forza wireless headset when it was released, but due to various issues I had with the headset I returned them. I've had a reliable set of Mpows for over 2 years, but I needed an upgrade or at least an improved battery life headset. So I tried a few Bluetooth headsets and compared including the Anker Slimbuds ($21), OldShark 4.1 magnetic headphones ($32), and the Senso $37 headphones with over 12,000 reviews. BTW, I chose to compare specifically these headsets since each has a manufacturer's warranty and an easy to reach website to contact the manufacturer if an issue arrises in the near future. Some of the better reviewed headsets had issue with finding the manufacturer's website or warranty info in the first place.

In terms of the headsets themselves, I liked some things about all three, but after spending some time with each headset I've concluded that the winner is definitely the cheaper Anker slim bids, though the Oldsharks were a close second. Surprisingly, I expected a lot more from the Senso headphones in terms of comfort and sound quality since it was the pricier headset, which unfortunately it was not. Though many have been happy with these headphones, I found too many issues that may not be obvious at first, but are more noticeable when comparing to 1 or 2 other sets of headphones.

1) The Senso's unlike the Ankers or the Oldshark uses and over the ear hook to keep the headphones in place. This along with the actual shape of the headphones seemed bulky and not as secure as the inner ear fins provided by the Ankers and OldSharks. Unlike the other two headphones, these did not sit as securely or comfortably inside the actual ear as I would have expected.

2) The buttons were a bit harder to press and use than I would have thought. Though the play/pause button was ok to use, skipping songs was really a bit more of an issue.

3) I may not have correctly triggered it, but unless I am mistaken, there is no Siri integration with these heaphones unlike the other two I tried. I don't use it often but I do need Siri abilities from time to time.

4) Both me and my Spouse compared all three headphones, and thought there were some minor differences between the Oldsharks and the Ankers, there was an obvious difference with the Senso's in a bad way. The music and lyrics sound garbled/muffled, like you're hearing the music through water when compared to the other two. Though both the Oldsharks and the Ankers did well and excelled at differenct aspects of treble and bass, the Senso's just sounded bad with the very same music.

5) One reason I felt that the Senso's would possible be a good option is that they are listed as 0.2 ounces for weight, when compared to the Ankers and Oldsharks 0.5 ounces (really 0.6 on a scale). I weighed the Senso's, and they were the heaviest at 0.7 ounces. I knew they wouldn't be 0.2 ounces, but I didn't expect them to be the heaviest either.

5) Lastly, I've noticed with certain BT headphones (including the V-moda Forza Wireless) that some BT headphones' volume control buttons affect the actual volume from the sound source (iphone volume), whereas other headphones have an independent volume to what the audio source volume is. The Ankers I'm happy to say control the actual volume directly on my iPhone, whereas the Senso's and Oldsharks have their own volume but does not control the volume from my phone directly. I've noticed having inversed volumes (Max in the headphones, low in the Iphone or Vice versa) can create some audio distortion at times. And although the Max volume one the Senso's + Max volume on the Iphone= Louder, it does not necessarily mean greater sound quality.

Overall, disappointed to say the least. From the reviews, I really thought I would have a hard time deciding between the three headphones, but the Senso's were easily eliminated from all aspects. Besides some specs and sweat/water proof abilities, there were no noticeable improvements that the Senso's had over the Ankers or OldSharks. Again, these differences may not seem noticeable unless you compare to an Aux headset or other pair of headphones which I recommend to compare with if you do purchase these headphones.

PROS:
The fit is great, they are very lightweight, comfortable and almost like they are not there.
Connectivity to the phone (iPhone) is fast. Did not lose connection once out of 5+ times that I wore them to work out.
Price is great.
CONS:
Well, after a few times of wearing them, and being very satisfied. The audio started to break. Just to make sure, I checked internet connectivity, it was fine. I checked Bluetooth connectivity, it was fine. I checked app behavior (Spotify) it was fine. Finally, I realized what triggered the issue. Whenever I tilted my head down (constantly when running) the audio will break. As long as I constantly kept looking straight ahead I could avoid the issue, but obviously, when running outside, that's never going to happen.

I have posted this review/rating because of my current experience. I will be fair will update my review based on the results of my return/reorder experience, as well as the performance of the replacement set. Stay tuned.
To listen to music is great. When on a call the sound is okay coming in but the sound going out I have been told sounds like I am talking under water. NOT CLEAR AT ALL.

I was going to get Apple AirPods, but fear losing one or both. With the Senso connected together they are more secure & less loseable. Sound is LOUD. Much louder than my Apple ear buds with or without Bluetooth adapter. Battery life is great. And they reach out to you TWICE before the first week to make sure you're satisfied. I'm buying another as a backup to use while the other one is charging. I use them about 12-14 hours per day.
Very good value for money
Well Done, loved the follow-up.
Best headphones I've had. Something about the soft design allows just enough air in for a perfect sound. Better than beats any day. They don't hurt your ears and are submergable.
Great headphones.  Sound is great and they stay on without slipping. I would definitely recommend.

I liked the package that came with it and the accessories, case and charging cable are nice.  I would have probably give a higher rating if they still worked.  Unfortunately I have gone back to my old headphones and am looking for a replacement.  I did contact support and will update the review if I hear back from them.

Easy to connect to iPhone 6+, went on a 5 mile run with no issues.  Every time I use them (3 days a week) the blue connectivity becomes worse and the battery does not last more than 30 minutes (yesterday was only 5 minutes) when they are fully charged. I am now giving this 4 stars. Since it magically startred working again andc they did get back to me and offer to make it right. Still do not no what went wrong so leaving it at 4 stars.

Dispite their strange email to me to review their product only a day or two after I receiived it and obviously not enough time to review anything I'm now ready to give you / them a review on this product.
After having used this product for a couple weeks now I do like this product. I use it driving to and from work listening to audio books or music in my car.
Pros - Nice sound, easy to use audio controls and I think they are fairly comfortable to wear for an hour or so.
Cons - Somewhat bulky and there is an obnoxious flashing LED light. My drive is in the early AM i.e. still dark out. This headset has an LED (light) that flashes every few seconds which throws off an annoying strob-light effect in my cab "and" bounces off the corner of my eye glasses. This is very annoying when driving. The fix? I put a little piece black electrical tape over the light. Much better now.
As for the battery life, I'm only getting about 5.5hrs before I'm hearing the battery low alert from the headset (5 hrs is more than enough for me).
Regardless of the cons I've mentioned. I would definitely recommend this product. Good price and after two weeks it's workiing well. Four instead fo five stars for the battery life discrepancy.
Looks good. Nice product.

I got these for my husband because he likes to walk at lunch and they said they were water resistant or water proof (we live in Seattle), they've been great for him! He uses they ALL the time, they have great sound quality and he's had no complaints.
Great product and sound quality. Not the most comfortable if you wear glasses due to the earpieces on these headphones, other than that, I have no complaints.
Two running sessions in with these and they work perfect, with the foam tips provided you barely notice they are on.

Great sound. I was worried about bass, but for me these headphones deliver excellent sound quality.

Do not pay attention to the 4 star review. Most of the high rated reviews are from over six months ago. I bought these for my girlfriend for her birthday, and the bluetooth connection constantly cuts out when she is out on a jog. We tried a factory reset as was recommended and it did not help. These headphones cannot even perform what they are advertised to perform due to cost cutting and a significant drop in quality.

The reviews were really good for these so I figured I'd give them a shot.

Fit - they don't necessarily fall out of my ears when I workout but they don't exactly fit in my ears with any of the other size buds. They do still get the job done in terms of noise canceling.

Sound quality - im not sure if it was any better the first two times I used them but the bass in my music is so horrendous I can't hardly stand even listening to it. It's half static when it comes out.

You get what you pay for though.

I purchased these for working out as well as helping me with sleep issues. I have music or podcasts on a timer so I can sleep without interrupting my husband. The largest issue is the battery. As soon as it hits 50% (as indicated by the battery icon when connected to Bluetooth) it start blaring an incredibly jarring BATTERY LOW every minute. The last 50% is quickly drained and BATTERY LOW keeps cutting through any audio you are listening to. Or, in a couple cases, a no longer deep sleep
It takes about 7-10 minutes of repeated BATTERY LOW interruptions before the earbuds die compleatly so I don't know how much of that is the battery percentage being inaccurate or the constant BATTERY LOW interruptions between audio. Don't waste your time or money on this product. Not worth the headache.
Sound quality is not good att all ,they get distorted real easy.
Very happy with this purchase so far. Tried it while doing weight training and they did not get in the way at all. I am going to do HIIT today and will update. Great headphones!

I've had more than 5 pairs of wireless bluetooth earbuds and the Senso ones are the BEST. It's true that they have about a 30 foot connectivity radius. I definitely recommend the blue/black version.

Hey everyone.

I purchased these because I drive a lot and my car doesn't have Bluetooth capability. In my state, it is very frowned upon to hold your phone up while driving so a Bluetooth headset was the best option. Big beats headphones would certainly have gotten the job done but for driving I don't think total noise cancellation is such a good idea. These seem to serve my purposes fine. As other reviewers have stated, this product has very good sound and feels soft and comfortable. The design is appealing to any one who moves frequently, whether you're a house wife who's got to clean room to room all day or a professional runner.

BUT: Because I purchased this product for driving purposes, hands-free dialing was the feature that ultimately lead me to buy these. The hands-free dialing is very misleading. They have a feature where you can hit the main button twice to dial the last number you called, and that's it. There is no voice dialing., so you'd better hope that the last person you called is the next person you want to call or else you're going to have to ask Siri/Cortana/Ok Google.

The good news is if you've got hands free dialing on your cell phone you can use the feature without pressing any buttons. For instance, I've got an iPhone 6s that allows me to "Hey Siri" without pressing a button, and that feature on the iPhone translates fine to the Bluetooth headset. Overall I'm really pleased. I'm also posting pictures of the instruction manual in case anyone wants to take a glance at the features before they purchase. Cheers!
For me, the comfort and fit was sub-standard compared to my Plantronic which I've used for years. Also the sound quality was horrid. This was a dud I'm afraid.

The headphones were pretty good; I thought everything was coming loud and clear, but when I was on the phone with my mom, she swore everything was staticky on her end. The issue isn’t as bad now, though. The hooking around the ears was awkward, but I managed.

The tough part for me was whenever I wanted to use just one side, like at work at my desk, it would hang heavy to one side, if I’m not careful, will tug on the cinch that’s on the back; in fact, I lost one for that reason. I thought you can just hang them around you neck when not in use, but they will shift from one side to the other. It’s been yanked by my seatbelt, scarf as I take them off. Plus, they don’t always stay connected; my phone will ring, and instead of being able to touch the button to answer, I have to pick my audio source on the phone to hear. It’s a great pair of headphones for the price, but it was also a little awkward because this is my first pair of headphones like these; normally I’d been getting the LG ones that hung solid on your neck.

I am a college student and I use these headphones about every day. Either walking to class or going to the gym, they are perfect for any type of activity. If you are working out and would like a pair where the cord is not in the way, these would be helpful. They are Bluetooth and have a small cord, so they can still hang around your neck and will not be in your way.

The headphones have great sound quality for the price. The base is good and not over the top. If you are looking for something to help you cut out sounds around you, these do a great job. These headphones have a voice action control, which is nice because it tells you when your battery is getting low, when the headphones are on/off and when someone is calling you. They will stop the music when someone is calling, to give you the chance to answer.

Many people have difficulty finding headphones that are comfortable and that fit well. If you are like me and have small ears, finding headphones that do not fall out is impossible. These finally fix that problem. They have hooks that wrap around your ear, helping them stay on. It comes with different size buds, so you will be able to change to what fits you best. Not only do they fit my ear, they are also very comfortable. I have had them on for over 3 hours and never felt any discomfort. If you tend to sweat a lot, you will not need to worry. These headphones are waterproof and will not cause discomfort or damage.

The battery life is impressive for these headphones. I wear them for about 2 hours every day and I only have to charge them about once a week. It only takes about an hour to charge. These headphones are easy to connect to your smart phone. The first time you have to let them sync. But every time after that, they will automatically sync when you have your Bluetooth and headphones on.

The only con I have about these headphones is the charging port. It is tough to open and it takes a little bit to get used to. It is very flimsy and could easily fall off. If you don’t mind the charging port to be showing, it might be easier to just take that off.

Overall, great headphones for only $30. I would highly recommend if you are looking to not spend much, great sound, good quality and comfortable headphones.

I enjoyed the battery life but not the faint humming they have now :(

I have only had these headphones for a short amount of time, but straight out of the packaging I started listening to music within seconds. Immediately had a 5 hour listening session trying to find something that didn't sound good on these headphones, listened to everything from hip hop to metal to salsa to merengue and everything in between and everything sounded crisp, clear, and loud even without cranking the volume. And also most importantly the headphones never were uncomfortable even having them on for the 5 hours straight. "These are the best headphones you can get, even better than other expensive ones."

This is the 3rd pair Ive purchased. My mom saw me wearing mine to cut grass and liked them. She said she’d love a pair for Mother’s Day. Very good quality for the price. 1st pair is over 3 years old. I lost them and bought another. The first pair got found and still wrk perfectly.

Battery life isn't as long as I had expected. I feel like I only get a good 6 hours of listening time. The battery indicator that shows up on my iPhone isn't accurate, either. the voice starts saying "low battery" around 30% (according to my phone), and once it starts to say "low battery," you've only got about 5 minutes of listening time left before it shuts off.

The Bluetooth connection on these headphones is terrible. The connection is interrupted BY MY OWN BODY. If I turn my head away from my phone, which I wear in a belt on the front of my body, the audio gets crackly and cuts out until I'm looking dead-ahead again. Forget 30 feet - maybe these will connect at 20 feet if there's nothing but air interfering. Maybe.

Some bluetooth headphones don't specifically say that they work with Siri (to activate it, anyway), but you can get it to work, like the last pair of QY7 headphones I had. You just have to hold the multi-function button *just* long enough to activate Siri, but not quite long enough to shut the power off. I can assure you, this will not work with these headphones. I've tried just about everything.

Other headphones have the ability to scan tracks, or to skip back 15 seconds on podcasts, but these do not. They work exactly as advertised - you can only skip whole tracks backward or forward by holding down the +/- volume buttons. Don't get your hopes up that they'll work in any different way.

The one thing I really do love is the ear hooks, which is the main reason I bought these. They are much softer and more flexible than I imagined, but because they are a rubberized material, they seem to hold onto your hears more by the grip of the material, not so much as an ear "clip." They feel much more secure when running and working out than other in-ear headphones. I've also had a hard time wearing the cord over the back of my neck with other headphones, because eventually they'll creep to one side and one ear will be pulled out. Haven't had that problem with these. Maybe because the cord is smoother, and most likely because of these ear hooks keeping the ear bud IN my ear! The only problem I've run into is fitting the ear hooks when I wear glasses running. I'll forego the ear hooks on my next purchase.

They have a good waterproof rating, but be warned that if you shower with them or they get more than just a little wet, the audio gets crackly until they dry back out again. I feel comfortable showering with them if I'm not going to wash my hair, so that's a plus, but not if I'm going to have water directly splashing onto them.

I have owned several different pairs of bluetooth sports headphones but nothing compares to the value, quality, and generosity of these so far. The price is a good balance - all of the others I bought were way too expensive. Yet, the quality was the surprise - I thought for the good price I would get poor quality but the care put into the construction of these, the packaging surrounding them, the audio output (including noise cancellation), the carrying case to protect them, the way they seem to be durably made to last a long time, and the extras included, simply blew me away - it was a delight. Finally, the generosity of the company - providing extras (the car mount, the card holder, and even this arm band) were a total surprise - something I haven't seen a company do in years - I wanted to express how appreciative I am and simply cannot express the surprise and joy it brought me. Please don't change anything - keep a good balance (so that you earn well but customers save enough), keep working on quality, and don't let accounting folks tell you that delighting people (with extras) will lead to decreased bottom line - it will cause your product to get recommended to others and will continue to be a bestseller, well reviewed, etc.

(NOTE: I've owned these five days now - will update this review if any negative experiences or more positive ones arise over time)

Update 6/8/2019 - It has been a few more days and I've exhausted the battery first time - charging now. The first chink in the armor is found but it is really a design choice. I got a warning 'low battery' during exercise and was hoping it was like an hour away warning and would happen every ten minutes or so. The warning was about once every two minutes. And I was about six to eight minutes away it seems. Then device shutdown leaving me a little bit miffed.
I doubt firmware updates can happen on these - so want to make a suggestion for future batches of this product: Please have it announce battery level much earlier and less often (hour away ideally, every ten minutes). Add a 'battery about to run out' (or 'battery critical') at the six-eight minutes mark. And ideally, if possible, have it announce battery level (yes, 'high', 'medium', 'low', 'critically low') at initial power up. If you make a set with these features, please let us know, I'll gladly buy another set (and will use these as my backup then).
Not enough to take any stars away - I'll work around it but would rather not run out of battery via surprise again in the future.

This was my first purchase of bluetooth earbuds. I reviewed several products from the low to high range and checked the feedback on the various products. I found several features that I felt were important for reliability and performance. They were durability, Android and Kindle Fire compatibility, sound quality, sweat resistance, and secure fit in the ear. Price was also a factor in my consideration because I did not want pay a lot and then be dissatisfied with the product. After reviewing the various earbuds and reading the feedback, I selected the SENSO S-250 earbuds because they advertised the features I was looking for as well as being  at a very reasonable price. They had the highest waterproof rating (IPX7), good playback of 8 hrs, Integrated Mic, control media playback, and hands free calling. The earbuds arrived promptly and I was impressed with the packaging. Usually you unpack the product and throw the box away. The box was well worth keeping to store the various components, booklet, cables etc.  I was impressed with the quality and feel of the product.  I installed the smallest set of ear tips and they stayed securely in the ear while I exercised. I also exercise on an elliptical/ recumbent machine and sweat quite a bit. I was concerned because the earbuds would get wet, but I simply wiped them off after exercising and I did not have problem with the moisture. The earbuds connected to my Android phone and Kindle Fire with no problem. The sound quality was much better than I expected. The base sounded great and yet was not overpowering. The vocal was clear and the volume levels had very good range. It was much better than I expected from a small set of earbuds. I feel it was a very good value for the price and I am very satisfied with my purchase of the S-250 earbuds. I have not yet had a chance to try them on a phone call.  I should point out that I have a background as a Manufacturing Engineer and dealt with quality issues as part of my job so I'm pretty picky. I would like to point out that I paid the advertised price for the earbuds and did not receive any compensation for my feedback.
I have smaller ears and they fit perfectly!  Now I haven't tried any other brands, but to me the sound is great.

Pros
+ Connect to multiple devices without issue.
+ Clearly displayed when on and connected.
+ Easy to use, turn on, and connect to a new device.
+ Decent battery life.
+ Decent microphone.
+ Comfortable! Have had no issues with either the earpieces or the over-ear loops being uncomfortable.

Cons
- Soft buzz/white noise in the earpiece. For me, it is in the left earpiece. If they are turned on, but no music is being played, it is not there. However, as soon as I hit play (when connected to any device) there is a constant white noise that is quite noticeable, especially when music is quite or in between songs. This is the most annoying aspect, but I tend to eventually block it out and ignore it.
- Band that connects the two earpieces takes getting used to and breaking in. It is a material that catches if you turn your head. For example, if I turn to the left, it will often grip my shirt and I feel the cord pull on the right side. It has not yanked out (due to over-ear loop), but can be annoying because I have to reposition it each time.

For the average user seeking a pair of wireless headphones for exercise or regular portable use, while also not wanting to spend $50+, I would recommend these headphones - they get the job done.
Good value, would buy again.
These are a great value for the price. Truly impressed. I've owned jabra and plantronics and these are just as good.... will report back on battery life...
The sound is terrific and the blue tooth set-up was very easy.

Comfortable, lightweight, loud. These are a great value. You definitely get your money's worth. They syn easily during set up and immediately every time I use them. The square shape may look bulky, but I forget I'm wearing them at the gym and running. I even wear them for hours at work with no issues. If I get more than 5 walls between me and my phone there is Bluetooth static, but the range is good walking around the office. I highly recommend these.
I like them a lot.  They sound great and fit very secure. Both important to my exercise routine.  I also appreciate the quick charging!
Product broke in a few weeks of use at the base of the ear piece - it just snapped off. Otherwise - great sound and loved using for my runs. Just wish it was heavier duty attachment.

I guess I'd love it if I had bigger ears.  The sound quality is great.  I love them to run in as well.  My ears are small so when I work out they never stay in place.  They are great for me when running or just talking and not moving much.  Won't blame the device for my ears.  LOL

Overall an excellent value. I use this headset for running and based on the last two 10k runs, I had no issues whatsoever with these falling off or the cable bouncing against/irritating my neck. The foam-earbud especially will fit to the shape of your ear canal and stayed in place. It fit so well that it filtered out most of the external voice so you'll have to be careful if you want to hear a bit of external noises. As other review suggested, there is a wind noise when running outdoor but I ran indoor most of the time.

The headphone works great and connected to my phone without any issues. Great sound quality and different earbud sizes ensured a great fit.

I received a newer version of this which doesn't come with the car chrager and charging cable but instead a card pocket and car mount for your phone. Upon contacting Customer Service -- they were very responsive and straight up with this transition and opted to ship out the accessories that was listed in the Amazon description.
Theae headphones are surprisingly good. They sound good to me and come with lots of extras! Definitely would buy again
Best wireless ear buds I have owned

these wireless earbuds are amazing for the price. they come with a carrying case multiple different eartips, and it also come with a magnetic phone mount for your car for some reason. the audio qaulity on these is also pretty good, but these are not audiophile quality. i highly reccomend these as they are basically a cheaper version of the Beats

Connect easily, sound is decent, sweat resistant enough for the gym.

If you want high quality, amazing, mind-blowing sound....spend $200+ on something else.

If you want an affordable, reliable product that does its job, I recommend these.
The headphones are really great, I've had the beats and in camparison to them, they are pretty dang close to each other except the price difference. I like these 100x better

these are great headphones with great sound and very easy to use with my iphone. I was concerned about the headphone's ability to be good for talking on the phone. as a matter of fact, they are great. There is no problem hearing me.

i originally purchased the Bose wireless ear buds, and i returned as they were not comfortable. The Senso earbuds are great! once i put in the smaller size cushions, i was fine!!

Highly recommended!
Got more bang for the buck with these ear buds, can't say enough good about them

Just received and they are exactly as described. Packaging is excellent and the quality of the product is superior. Have used several times now and find the fit and sound quality far superior to any other wireless ear buds I have tried.The range is fantastic.
Fast shipping.  Good sound quality.  They fit my ears perfectly.  Thank you

I have had these headphones for two years now and finally have to retire them.

Pros:
Good sound quality
Pairs easily
Lasts 2 years without an issue
Battery life has lasted, I got about 8 hours new and about 6 hours used
Comes with awesome accessories. Makes it worth the buy alone.

Cons:
Improper fit- unless you have large ears, they will not fit properly for long runs. If you are weight lifting or walking you won't have a problem.
String (wire) length- slightly long so it will stick to your neck and pull on the ear when you turn you head.
Material quality- The wire is finally starting to fail. The sound in the left ear piece is intermittently transmitted through the wire, making the headphones too annoying to use.

Overall a good buy for the price. Two years of use (5 days a week) for this price isn't bad. No buyer's remorse.

I had no problems connecting to any devices with these pair of headphones, I just don't like the fit of them. They're pretty big and uncomfortable. I don't think I have small ears but these seem to fit better for someone with really large ears. Even when I adjust the buds, they still don't fit quite right.

Hello, my name is Jorge.I want to say, Thank You  For this Senso, Bluetooth headphone. I am so happy with my new Senso Bluetooth. It is a high quality product. And I recommended everyone to try  this Senso Bluetooth. Thank you.

Yes received my Senso headphones, nicely packaged! After reading instructions, which did not indicate, that they needed to be charged first. Easily Bluetooth sank them with my I phone 7! They were fully charged already. Turned on my music, if my vast music collection! And I can say, they sounded even, more spectacular than the ad boasted. Crisp high treble, and perfect low bass notes! I consider myself a music aficionado , and the sound is awesome, far exceeding my expectations! These here headphones are excellent, easy to use, and control the. Buttons. I listen to two newly acquired albums, while preparing dinner, took one short phone call, one button push to receive the call. Pushed same control button to end call, and song picked up where I left off. I will tell my friends about these headphones, and I predict many more sales! Thank you so much, for making these headphones for me!
One happy customer, Robert Ahrens 😎

The first pair I bought seemed to be broken. The left earpiece (the one with all the buttons and ports) was very distorted. To the point where any song at any volume just won't sound right when listening through both earpieces (the right headphone works fine). The distortion or buzz is less noticeable when watching a youtube video.
Charged headset after I received but it never powered on.

I ordered the wrap around headphones originally, and when they arrived, they were exactly as advertised. I however have smaller ears, and the wrap around rubber part did not secure them well for me. I emailed them about the issue, looking to get a different pair.

I believe about 30 minutes later I had an email apologizing for the inconvenience, and asking how they could help. They offered to send me new headphones for free, which I believe are the S300 instead of the S200.

I had the new headphones in about 3 days, and they are incredible. I workout about 5 times a week and use them every time, as well as when around the house, mowing the lawn, etc.

These are awesome headphones for the money, and frankly, I bought into the whole Beats fad when I was younger, and was less than impressed. I however am very very impressed with these.

Thank you!
Very goid Bluetooth and great sound

Sound is quite good.  Easy to use and variety of earbud sizes.  Works great for treadmill and upright working out.  However the loop that goes over the ear is very flimsy and they tend to fall off when doing floor exercises.
Good quality
Bought these to pair with my Peloton and they work great. Was debating buying a WAY more expensive pair but am so glad I went this route. The sound quality is great and saved a bunch of money.
Loving them
Great price and service.
Very good product but, needs to add a USBC connector for newer Android phones, other than that it syncs well and the clarity is awesome.

We have purchased multiple sets of these headphones they work great.  We did have a problem with one set losing sound in one ear but the customer service was outstanding and a replacement set is on the way.  When we contacted customer support they replied within hours with troubleshooting steps and when those did not work they said they would send a new set.  All this happened within days. Very impressed with customer service and with the product.
They are great
They are too flimsily around the ear, does not fit me well tho they seem like a well made product. Wish they fit better they are smartly designed and seem very high quality.

I have smaller ears and this is my third style/brand of wireless earbuds I've tried in the past few months. I returned the first two brands because they wouldn't stay in my ears. I LOVE THE SENSO buds. The fit AND sound are awesome and they are waaaaaay less expensive than the other two brands I tried. (Those were Bose and Plantronic.)

Super easy to set up. Terrific sound. Plentiful accessories (like chargers, cables, etc.). I just got them yesterday, so I can't really attest to the "actual" charge capacity, etc., but if it really does sound this good for 8-hours when charged, I'm thrilled. AND at a fraction of the cost of similar products from Apple or Beats. Get 'em!

Love it!
I personally have only 1 problem, not with the actual product though but, when I received my headphones everything (wireless headphones, eartips, charging cable, 3-feet dual port charging cable, carrying case, & dual port car charger) was present minus the wire tie.

The sound is horrible, and more like a bee hive. I don't feel like using it so bad. The bliethooth connection is good, but the sound that comes out of the box looks like those headphones from the 1980s.

so I bot these to swim...not submerged much though they claim they are fine doing so.  Bot one pair, died on 2nd swim.  they were decent about replacing..  2nd pair just as bad...  1 swim, no longer charges.  DO NOT buy if you plan on being near water, ok for running, etc
Sound quality is amazing! It's convenient and I love that it stays put during my hard sweat sessions.

Odd looking, but they really do fit well and are not a bother to wear for long periods of time. The sound is fine and the battery recharges well. I do wish something were different about the connecting wire, maybe stiffer?? don't know, but I am just an old fussbudget.
As a accessory, they are great, work well and come with 2 storage options - a cardboard sliding drawer for by the table, AND a really NICE zippered carrying case for out and about. Yes, I would get them again, and probably will if and when the battery dies.
Colors would be a good new option.
Like the earclip, stops the headphones from slipping out of my ear.

Bought this for my husband, and didn't realize that it can sync up to our smart TV via bluetooth. So he can watch tv while the baby and I are sleeping without the loud noise. It's a great product that I just bought another one today from the lightening deal!
After a couple of weeks the voice thing stopped working
great for the price.

These easily stayed on my ears for all 10 miles of my run. They are light weight and the sound quality is plenty good enough.  I could still hear wind noise on a windless day (wind was from my slow running pace!), but that is OK.  I will warn people that these cannot be worn if your cell phone is in your left shorts pocket.  The bluetooth constantly dropped the signal which was so annoying I wanted to stab a pencil in my eye.  After 5 miles of fuming and plotting how I would return them and write a scathing review, it occurred to me that the bluetooth receiver is probably on my right ear and the signal has to travel through 3 feet of body tissue from my left pocket.  Sure enough, when I switched the phone to my right pocket everything worked great.  My eyes are forever grateful.
Worked well and had good sound.  Broke within 2 months.
Love these
Awesome headphones!!!
Broke after one use!!
We have had these headphones less than a year, and my husbands stoped working completely and mine are on the fritz, they go in and out..  Invest in something else
The earpieces are too flimsy and do not hug the air making the earphones fall out all the time
After constantly replacing wired earbuds I finally decided to try bluetooth.  They work great!

The product is fairly decent. The price isn't much, the noise cancelation could be better, they're comfortable, but the volume range is pretty limited. Overall, it is a good set of headphones to have at the gym when you don't want to risk damaging something expensive.
Priced right, sound is great, comfortable fit
Sounds great as headphones. People cannot hear me when using bluetooth to talk on phone.

Awesome value at $36. Easy to link to your phone and the sound quality is more than acceptable for the price. Lots of accessories included in the box. Recommend for travel,pool and beach or anywhere. Just picked up another pair for my wife as well.
I like the headphone generally speaking. The base is a bit lower than I was expecting as I typically listen to audio books.

These are excellent.  Comfortable with decent sound quality.  I use them to run, they are stable and fit well. Pairing is easy, daily on and off and pairing, easy.  This is the 2nd pair I've owned (the first pair went for a long cooling swim - my fault) and if anything I am even more pleased with the model upgrades from the first to second pair.
The sound is good and they hold steady in my ears through weight training and cardio.
grt

It connected to my Pixel which is difficult to do, so I will give it that. The sound was good as well, however the piece that goes around the ear is a flimsy piece of rubber that does not hold it in your ear. It is not adjustable and has no stability at all. It is a loose, very loose piece of rubber that does not hold it in your ear.
Calls using these suck!!!!

They are quite comfortable and were very easy to understand the setup. My son also bought a pair,
Ike's them so much he bought an additional pair as a backup.

They are wireless,  that's the only thing going for them.  If you're looking for noise cancelling,  these are NOT for you!  Edited to add that the description  lists these as water proof (I wouldn't try to find that out) and noise reduction (which they are definitely not).  The loops to go around the ear are too big to actually fit correctly.

Delivery of the product was as posted. The set up for the headphones was not too difficult.  And the sound is fantastic.  For $35, I was nervous about the quality. I have used the headphones only a couple of times, but I feel I've received a great quality product. Thank you.

It is not soft in ears and it is a little heavy when I wear it.
I don't like it and I don't recommend it. I regret for this purchase.

I bought these headphones about a year ago.... so have had some time with them now and here is my thoughts:

Pros:
- packaging is nice
- you get some nice kit along with the headphones (eg the car charger and cable are pretty nice, seems like good quality tho I haven’t really used them much and just charge at home)
- they las a reasonably long time and charge in a reasonably short time

Meh’s
- sound quality is so-so. The base is overbearing, the treble is muted and sounds distant. Highs are definitely rolled off. Sounds stage is cheap sounding.
(Am I an audiophile? Not really... I have a few high end cans and try to buy the best in my albeit limited budget so have some experience with both good and crummy headphones)

Bad:
- the ear clips (whatever it’s called that goes around your ears) are garbage. They have the support of a wet noodle. Headphones consistently work their way out of my canals and have to repeatedly be pushed back in, both during workouts and at rest.

Final verdict:
Meh. They’re what you get for cheap. I have a few pairs of this style, mainly because I wasn’t satisfied with these and wanted something that wouldn’t fall out of my ears all the time.... however the sound of these is slightly better than those.

I would not recommend these. I would not buy them again if the ones I have conk out. (I’m always on the cusp of giving them away but then I have to spend more cash to replace them and they’re not terrible).

They work, but just so.

Hope that helps (in the scheme of 30K+ reviews, statistically 60% of which are fake... seriously. Look it up!!... happens almost across the board).

Cheers.
Very good sound quality for the price. Great for running!

I ordered 2 pair which were opened on Christmas morning.  Each recipient was very excited to receive them.  However, I have returned 1 pair as the right earbud did not work properly with no sound at all unless pressure applied to earbud and then it was intermittent.  I have reordered hoping there is not a problem with the new pair.
Works better than expected. This has been my 3rd. Pair over the years. Awesome noise cancellation for loud construction environment.... they can almost double as safety plugs
Anniversary gift for husband to go with his new Fitbit...he loves them!!  Pro: noise-cancelling.  No cons.

Good sound. Deeper bass than any other low priced earbuds I've tried. Great value too. It comes with a case and car charger. The only thing I don't like is that the ear pieces are just soft silicon that are non-adjustable and they don't fit me well so offer absolutely no support. The ear pieces just flop around and get in the way of my glasses. Otherwise, these earbuds feel like they are good quality and well built but this also means they are on the heavy side.
I’ve had these for a little over a year now and I still love them. Good sound, comfortable and the battery lasts.
Great sound quality with rich tone.  Pairing and set up were very easy.  The fit is solid.  I use them to workout and they remain in place in with vigorous activities.

I just used these earbuds for the first time. 100 mile motorcycle ride at speeds up to 70 mph.  Great sound, no problems with wind noise and ver comfortable.  I wish I had bought them sooner and saved myself some money and hassle of the previously purchased earbuds that kept falling out and didn't have the quality of sound that these do.  Cost and quality equals outstanding buy. Waiting on the three year warranty I purchased for about 6 bucks. If no problems with registering for warranty then I will recommend highly and probably purchase more for my fellow firefighters!

These headphones sound is fine but they fall off in almost all my workouts.  The earpiece is adjustable and you would think they would stay but they just dont.  Still using them because i cant return.
They work great and are about the only wireless that seem to stay in my ears while working out and getting sweaty!
Just got these, so far great!  My only question with the instructions is how to use the wire ties? Guess I'm a dummy :(
Paired nicely with phone and fit well in my ears when jogging. After 5 months, one ear bud did not work. After 12 months it could not hold a charge.

I liked this product even thou it didn't work with my MacBook pro, it worked perfectly with both my iphone and android phone.
Ii'm pretty careful handling them but after 6 months of light use now the sound is only coming from one ear, so i'm gonna contact senso and come back to update this review.
Best ear buds I have ever used.
Attractive and functional package.  Head phones work great and seem to pick up blue tooth signals up to 50 feet away.  I think they are a bargain!

Nicely packed and really like the extra earbud sizes included.  Easy Bluetooth pairing with an iPhone 6, btw the multifunction button is on the side of the right earphone.  Had them in for 30 minutes and super comfortable , barely notice them.  Volume and track controls work very well.  Call quality is fine and these get plenty loud.  Caller had no problem hearing me and I had no problem hearing them.  Started listening to my playlist and rock, pop, and some classical.  Btw, I listen to the same 10 to 15 songs almost everyday on a pair of decent mid range Sony buds.  The Senso's have a nice mid range, but low frequency bass drum, bass guitar are not impactful.  The high frequencies are smooth but I think they are very slightly distorted/crackling, however I only really noticed it on Metallica's And Justice for All via Apple music, didn't notice it much on other tracks.  No comment on battery life, will post a follow up.
I had these for a few weeks, then one day they melted while charging.
My kiddos bought these for me to swim with.  It says they are waterproof.  Not true.  Very disappointed.  Couldn’t wait to get to the pool.  So let down.

After some initial trouble getting my iPhone 7 ( which was probably the phone's fault) to pair with these headphones, the rest of my experience has been great. They are comfortable to wear and provide great sound and insulation from outside noise.
I loved it! everythig was perfect!

I run a lot, and after about 35 minutes or so, they pretty reliably lose their bluetooth connection and it can't be restored for around 40 minutes. Tried a lot of troubleshooting and a replacement set, which had the same issue. I don't over-charge them or plug them into quick charge outlets, it just seems like a glitch in the product. Definitely not trying out a third pair! They tend to lose connection in the middle of a long run or workout which is very frustrating. Good customer service team, however; very fast and responsive and offered me a coupon to replace my defective sets. I wish the product was better, when they work the sound is good and they're comfortable to wear.

easy to setup and to use.
I've only used them twice with my iphone music - once sitting at home and once on a 50 mile bike ride.
Sound is very good and controls even riding with biking gloves on are easyu to use.

Best set of bluetooth ear buds for the money!  Sound quality is amazing and the ear buds have the extra feature of having the ear clips to keep them in place when you are out and about on a run or walk.  Can't be happier with my decision to purchase the SENSO Bluetooth ear buds.
Great battery life. Good sound. Water resistant. If put in properly they stay in ears when with sweat and high impact.
It is the most comfortable earbuds I've ever used.  I have Jabra wireless earbuds but SENSOs quality and comfort is far superior.

This is a really good product. It has a lot of great features, most of which have been touched on by other reviewers. I was pleasantly surprised by how multi-functional the buttons on the earpiece are. They also come with a bunch of charging accessories that honestly seem like bonuses. It can't hurt to have them around! The sound quality and range are pretty good. The only problem I have with it is the little wire that connects the two earpieces. It's quite short and ends up touching my neck. I generally don't like things touching my neck and this can feel kind of cold. In any case, I would really love it if they came up with a fully wireless headset. The right piece can receive the signal from the playback device and then send the stereo signal to the left piece. I'm not an engineer, so maybe this is not a good idea, but the wire is the reason I'm not giving it 5 stars.
These are great. Love them in the gym on Bluetooth. Would buy again!
Great product amazing sound! Really got my money's worth!
Mal esta vez me dalio más caro avia comprado uno antes y este no trae cable USB y no trae gomitas de repuestos

Love these headphones! I have been using these while working around my yard, so lots of movement. They stay in great! The sound quality is excellent. And the volume and song adjustment buttons are easy to use, even with dirty hands!!
And finally, I loved all the extras that came in the package! Especially the charge chord designed both for the headphones and iPhone, genius!
Also comes with a second chord, carrying case, car adapter, extra foam earbuds! I highly recommend this product. Great value for the money!

Overall, these headphones aren't bad.

Sound Quality: This might have been the best headphones I've ever heard. There is a really nice bass and the sound overall is really clear. It has great noise cancellation so you can't hear other noises, and people near you can't listen to what your listening.

Comfort: The headphones were bigger than expected. It came with three ear pieces (Small, Medium, and Large). It also came with a nice foam piece that you can form into the size you want. The hook works well and it stays in your ear.

Connection: The connection to your device is simple and easy (Took around 3 minutes). The length though is a little disappointing, it works for around 15 feet away from your device before it starts to become staticky and un-listenable.

Extra: The box came with a charger (way to small (3 in.) ), a usb to Apple lightning charger, a car charger, and a small pouch. I was king of disappointed when 1 day after I ordered these head phones, the price dropped down from 35 to 20 dollars. The strand that connects the two together is a little bit lengthy and can get tangeled up.
I love my new headphones! They connected immediately to my iPhone and my music sounds great! Thank you!
Love the headphones. Went out for a 3 mile run and liked the sound quality. Also liked the way that the earbuds fit in my ear.

I had bought the senso bluetooth to replace apair of boom beats that I had lost. Quite frankly I  could not tell of any difference between the quality of sound for both devices. The major diffence to me was the difference in the price and the what I  saved when buying the senso instead of the boom beats.

For the price you pay, the sound is more than decent. If you want perfect, studio quality sound while in the gym - it doesn't exist - unless you want to wear large, cumbersome, over-the-ear head phones that cost you $300+

If you are like me and looking for something you can wear in the gym, that you can run in, jump in and do burpees and all that jazz, then this is the pair you want. The best thing about these headphones is the reliability. You can expect them to "work" every session as long as you keep them charged. Ehh, the occasional vol +/- button failure but it will still play. Absolutely sweat-proof. I am a very serious sweater in the gym, often times I walk in with a grey shirt and come out with a black one with sweat dripping off these buds and they keep going. If the buttons break or won't respond or anything else goes wrong, you can always call Senso and claim the warranty. That is what I did and they sent another pair out to me very quickly. I definitely recommend these over those $100+ earbuds any day! Hope you found this review helpful

Wow I was about to spend 300 dollars on a pair of bose qc 30s. But I saw these for only 36 bucks with great and they're waterproof!? So I got them and I gotta say wow I'm very impressed. They sound great. Only thing that I don't like is that they don't have a voice command option. But besides that I love them. And I just saved 250 bucks. Sorry bose! Maybe it's time to lower your prices.
Battery life is LITERALLY the best thing ever, it lasts so long. The sound is 10/10.
I got these headphones on a promo and wasn't sure how well they would sound or work but was presently surprised at how good they sounded. I use them every day. Well worth the money.

These headphones work great! They fit nicely and come with many options in case you need to change the fit.

The USB cable is a micro + iPhone 5 and higher cable, very nice!

They sound great and the media buttons make it a treat to use at work.
I have owned these headphones for two months and maybe a total of 10 times. The Bluetooth will not connect with my devices anymore.  I tried to return them and the return window expired. Do not buy!!

Bought these recently for my sons birthday.  He loves them.  He says they have good sound quality and are easy to use.  He highly recommends these as a fantastic alternative to other headphones that are twice the price.

The sound is great and they fit well. However after about 10-20 mins on my neck they radiate my neck and make this weird tingling burning sensation on my neck. I had to stop using them. Taking them back

I am happy either with the purchase so far .
Plus good customer services, and easy to reach
Very convenient to use and sleek. A great innovation
Bought it for my daughter's Birthday. Headphones keep falling off. "earhooks" not adjustable. Sound is good, but unusable in the gym which was their main purpose.

They weren't lieing when they mentioned HD sound. These sound great and are far more comfortable than my beats. The bass is great but not spectacular. I give these a 9.5 compared to beats, but 10 for the value.
Delivery was very prompt. Overall quality is good will do the job just fine , sound could be louder.
They work great
Earphones are great sound comes thru nice and crisp

I purchased these for my son for a Christmas present.  I had owned a couple of pairs over the past few years so I thought they were pretty good.  He finally started to use them about three weeks ago.  They stopped turning on after two weeks use.  But, it was more than a month since I had purchased them (before Christmas) so I could not do an Amazon return.  Very disappointed in these.  I guess I am done purchasing this product.  I was going to update this review to mention that the seller replaced the headphones and was very responsive.  That is great.  However, the replacement headphones after a month, melted down (literally) while charging overnight!
The left earphone is never silent. There is always an annoying ringing noise - gives me a headache. But the sound quality is OK for the price.

I found the sound to be quite good however they did not set securely in my ears and would likely fall out if bumped ever so slightly.  The soft piece that wraps around the top of the ear is very flimsy (comfortable) but did not in my experience offer much additional securement.  The soft ear bud tips would not insert far enough into my ears due to the design of the headset.  I will continue to use my 4 year old Motorolas until I can find a better replacement.

I purchased the headphones on October 11, 2016, the headphones were very unusable. First, the silicone ear loops are flimsy and will not stay secure around the ears. This did not pose a great deal of dissatisfaction as I was able to overcome this issue by tucking the curved part of the loops above the ears under my cap while running. However, the real concerns with the headphones lays in these serious issues. The battery drains completely in less than an hour of operation from full charge state. The charging port of the headphone is malfunctioning and does not maintain a secure connection causing the charging process to halt. I had to keep wiggling the charging cables until the red LED charging pilot turns on indicating that the headphones are charging. moreover, it became very annoying and tedious process for me to exercise extreme caution every time I try to charge the unit and while placing the headphone down to finish the charging process and to avoid the headphones from getting disconnected again and to come to realize that the headphones were not charging and I wasted hours of valuable time. The company does not have a customer service phone number for product support, rather they resort to a message process form. I was hoping that the company will be responsive and prompt to answer and address my concerns, but I guess I was misled be the highly sophistication and the well-prompted product propaganda.  This is very frustrating and I feel that my money went down the drains. I can’t recommend this product

My husband LOVES these. They are so worth the money. I looked for a month? Reading reviews, trying out other peoples and then I stumbled upon these. What sold me was the comfort aspect and all the extras that can with them. They are perfect.

I had high hopes but sadly the ear phones  did not fit as I had hoped. I have kind of average sized ears, maybe a little on the small side. I do not like things inside my ears because of an ear wax issue that i have. I read some reviews and the different sizes of ear thingies made me hopeful. I'm an athlete and I run as much as I can. I needed ear buds that don't fall out while I'm running. These ear phones did not pass the test. The rubber parts that go around my ears are too soft plus they don't even touch my ears where they are supposed to to keep them on my ears. I literally had to stop running often to push and try and twist the buds far enough into my ears to make them stay for another few feet of my run before I had to stop and do it again. The sound is good if I can get them to stay but since they don't, the sound becomes like in a tin can as they say.

Huge upgrade to a balky Jabra Sport and exactly what I was looking for!  Audio is much better than I expected at this price point, clear crisp treble and mid range with warm bass and excellent volume controls.  Immediately detected by my Samsung 7S and pared instantly.  Included a functional set of accessories in a compact storage case.  Button controls are in all the right places making it easy to adjust volume, skip tracks, answer phone calls, even has a redial option.  So far not a single CON I can come up but we'll see how the phones hold up after sweating buckets in the hot Midwest summer.  A great value overall and would definitely recommend to friends.
Horrible died in one month. The price is what you get.
It works but the size of ear doesn’t fit well and the microphone works great. Whenever I use the microphone of the earphone, my voice sounds like far away

tl;dr: Great headset if you're never 10+ ft from your phone

I bought this pair so I could listen to music while skating (headphones and earbuds were falling out due to the strong centripetal forces from spinning). Unfortunately, the Bluetooth connection craps out if you're more than 10 ft from your broadcasting device (my iPhone). It just gets poppier and poppier until it completely disconnects, which means it's pretty much useless for what I wanted.

In it's defense, this headset is at an excellent price point for the great sound quality and the noise cancelling (muffling) it provides. It's also very comfortable to wear, and the over ear wire is adjustable to mold to your ear. Throughout 3 hrs of very active skating, it never fell off, although the earbud did pop out of my ear once or twice. I third the people saying the red foam earbuds are the best; the other ones felt very hard and uncomfortable.
No complaints

Works fine out of the box, comfortable on the ears (at least mine) and also comes with different sizes for the ear plugs.  Sounds great and is secure when working out.  I got this at 29 on a lighting deal and they are a good deal at that price
Easy to operate and sound is fine for gym and pool
Like the fit

I bought these for my daughter. She said they are comfortable and work very well when she wears them at the gym. She said they connect quickly to her Iphone, the sound is great and so is the bass. The only down side is that the earbuds need to be in her ear a certain way or the sound gets muffled. But overall she recommends them and is happy with the purchase!

Just as good, if not better than the Beats wireless I had before the wire broke through on the over the ear part of it. Very comfortable, easy to pair. Quality and battery life excellent. Amazed at all I got for the price (car charger too!)
very solid product for the price!

The sound quality on these is awful. I am going to return them.

great deal for the money. works as expected. came with a lot of unexpected goodies like a nice carrying case, car charger, multiple earbuds, and cord management pieces. did not come with a usb wall charger but I already have dozens of those laying around my house. wanted something for the gym so the profile of the ear pieces are not a big deal but I wouldn't use these for my daily commuting needs since it's not very discreet looking.

One odd thing was that it came with a short micro usb cable for charging but it also came with a USB to Apple Lightning type cable which makes no sense whatsoever since you can't use it on these headphones. Gave it to my daughter for her iphone.

I bought two pairs of these a while back, one for me, one for my husband, and within 2 months both pairs were dead.  I didn't even bother requesting  a replacement... I'd rather just go with a different brand in general seeing as both pairs from the same brand/model are dead.

These are comfy and pair pretty easily, and the sound quality is OK for the price point. However, the shape and construction ensure that even the tiniest breeze will translate into a ton of wind noise in your ear. Trust me, no one can run slowly enough that this won't be a problem.  I also have sever doubts that this meets an ipx7 rating, which should mean these could be submerged underwater for half an hour. The little rubber gasket that covers the charge port is flimsy and insubstantial, and on mine, it doesn't stay in the charge port, falling out with the slightest handling of the earphone. I don't need to sink these in water, but I sweat enough to destroy electronics that aren't truly waterproof, and there's no way these will stand up to real summer running without getting soaked. Sadly, I'll be returning. These will be OK if you are only using them inside or on an airplane or similar.

These are pretty good headphones. The memory foam ear tips are awesome. I damaged one of the memory foam ear tips while trying to take it off to clean it, so I contacted the company to see if it was covered under the warranty. It was and they sent me 2 sets of replacement memory foam ear tips! I emailed the company and literally got a response within minutes. The product is solid, the sound is great, they connect very easily to my devices, and seem to charge quickly and hold their charge for a long time.
It is comfortable to wear at the gym. Sound is fairly good. I love the price it's really affordble for a good wireless headphone.

good fit, stable and easy to work.  mic quality is very good, clear and responsive.  sound quality is decent, good bass response and mids are very strong. the highs are a little on the low end to my taste and at higher volumes music can sound a little muddy.  movies and phone calls the sound is very good and clear.  the ear hooks keep the buds in place very well without causing discomfort or fatigue and i can even wear my favorite sunglasses and i have very close earlobes.  if my phone or if the headphones had a means of a graphic equalizer to adjust the tone balances these would be the perfect purchase in my opinion (again, for music sound and quality and i am very picky about that) and you simply cannot beat the price for the quality.  a very good product and the company is thoughtful from build to components all the way to accessories.  thank you for a good product and best of luck with your company.  i'm looking forward to your other items in the future.

These headphones are good for the price point, but have a few annoying features.

The sound quality is decent and they work for a commute, not sure if they would stay in for a run or other high impact activities. I don't mind the buttons, but they do take an adjustment period because they aren't intuitive.

My two main complaints are that while the sound quality is good, if I put my phone in my bag or pocket it will cause the audio to breakup like the connection is not very good. It sounds like the horrible days when a cd would skip. It's constant and completely annoying. My only recourse is the carry my phone. This works, but is a complete pain that I cannot put my phone in my bag and be hands free!

Secondly, the stupid low battery announcements are a bad design and they start when the headphones have 30% battery. I can almost understand if the percentage is off, but the stupid lady cuts in every minute with "low battery" for a solid five to six minutes before the headphones shut off. One low battery notification is enough. Also, if they do cut off because the battery dies, you then have to resync to your phone when they are charged.

Overall, they fit the purpose, but if you can afford better quality, go for it.

These are pretty good. The sound quality and base are both great, and they shouldn't leave you wanting for much more, despite the price and quality assurances of name brands.

I found it easier to both put on and wear these with the strap in front like a sombrero rather than across the back like bifocals. Easier to turn the head without the strap getting snagged, as well as being less awkward to put on.

Battery life is good so far, as is volume and comfort. Connects quickly after the first time. The voice could be a bit more natural sounding, and the volume buttons should've been switched, but these are minor niggles.

If you must have something that'll better impress the Jones, then go for LG's HSB-810 model with retractable earbuds and JBL sound. But it'll definitely cost you more new, and you won't get all the awesome freebies.
Left bud ceased working after two weeks. They are sending a replacement pair out to me

So, first off, for the price, the sound is great and the range is amazing!  I can walk 45 feet from my phone with these in my 1949 (thick walls) home and I still have reception.  But the battery life is funky.  You hold the side button on the right earbud to turn on and off, and a voice comes on and says "power on" or "power off."  Fine.  But I've found when I clearly turn them off, and I've charged them relatively soon beforehand, they still go dead very fast.  So it seems the "power off" really isn't turning it off, and it's draining battery life.  The red or blue light on the side of the right earbud tells you whether it's powered or not, and it's tiny--which is good overall, so there's not some annoying light coming from your ear if you're in a dark space or a library--so that's not the issue.  It just seems to drain battery charge, even when it's supposedly not on.  Upshot:  I'm always charging these things, which is a bit of a pain.  I need to start doing this the way I charge my computer--just plug them in every night.  So if you don't mind charging all the time, these are terrific.  And they STAY ON.  The wrap-around ear band is wet-noodle-y flexible, and once you get used to that, it's a terrific feature, because they don't bind or pinch.  And for folks like me who have trouble getting earbuds to stay in, these REALLY DO.  Good luck!

I wear my phone in an arm band, so the signal doesn't have far to go, and I've used my phone successfully with other bluetooth headphones- so it makes me deduce the issue is the headphones. The controls are the exact opposite of every other Bluetooth headset I've owned. When listening to music, the front button is the "back" button to repeat the track. The back button is the "skip" button to go to the next track.

The sound up/down and skip/repeat functions are also the opposite. I'm used to tapping the forward button once to skip a song. But with this headset, you have to hold it down and wait. So if you're trying to skip multiple songs at the same time, it takes FOREVER.

The quick tap function is to raise and lower the volume, which is something I rarely feel the need to do. Certainly far less than skipping/repeating songs. So like I said, the functions are opposite from what they should be.

Arrived Immediately, wasn't expecting the extra attachments.  Silly me, I had to call because the charging cable did not fit my android phone.  All I had to to do was pull the iPhone end out to reveal the android plugin. However, they answered my call immediately and I was on my way. Good Product I would recommend

Before I start with the negatives, let's go with the positives first. In terms of comfort, packaging, and overall aesthetics, I was immensely satisfied with the product. The earbuds themselves feel robust and without being cumbersome or heavy. The product also has a very slick low-profile look to it, which I liked a lot, as well as the reliability of the battery (I didn't get a full 8 hours but close to it). So purely from that standpoint, the product is a 5/5.

But in terms of what actually matters to me the most--the sound--these earbuds fell TERRIBLY short. Now I'll preface with the fact that I'm not an audiophile; I used $20 Skullcandy sports buds before this product. But the sound in these was so lackluster that it wasn't unlike the $10 earbuds you'd buy at the gas station. The treble in these is fine for me, but it's the mid/low-range notes and bass that made me feel like I had to return the product as soon as possible. Most of the music that I played (from a variety of genres) sounded muddled, so you'll almost certainly need to tweak your EQ settings in whatever music app you use in order to bring more clarity and bass to these earbuds, because they aren't really up to par straight out of the box.
These were awkward for me. Didn't hold much battery duration.  Not what I really wanted.

Never power off or disconnected. I had just charged them so dead battery.
